Wij bieden ook de mogelijkheid om je in te leren in onze producten en diensten om je te kunnen ontplooien als echte specialist. Als jij ons het nodige te bieden hebt, dan zorgen wij voor een prachtig pakket arbeidsvoorwaarden. Wij zijn heel benieuwd naar jouw ambitie!
Are you a resident outside the European Union? And if you do not have a work permit, unfortunately we cannot process the application.
Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Meer weten?
Neem contact op met onze recruiter!
Saranda Bekker
T: +31 (0)74–2915208
sbe@victa.nl

Vereisten
Minimale HBO opleidingsniveau
Minimaal 3,5 jaar werkervaring
Python, Python, Python, Python, Python en Python
Python libraries en frameworks als Pandas, scikit-learn, PySprak, Keras, TensorFlow, Airflow en Flask en al die andere mooie Python dingen…of tools als Kafka...
Kennis van methoden zoals Agile, Scrum en DevOps: CI/CD pipelines / Jenkins / Containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes) / etc...
Kennis van Relational en NoSQL databases
Kennis van Cloud (Azure, AWS, etc)
Aanbod
Salaris tussen de €3.800 - €5.500 bruto (Afhankelijk van je ervaring)
26 Vakantiedagen
8% Vakantiegeld
€700 bruto mobiliteitsvergoeding of een leasebudget van €900 met onbeperkt brandstof (Reiskosten bruto/netto uit laten declareren en wat over blijft is van jou!)
€50 netto voor telefoonkosten
Een winstbonus! Deze hangt af van de omzet die het team en jij samen behalen!
Pensioenregeling: 2/3de van de premies door Codebeez, 1/3de voor mdw. bij Stip
Volop opleidingsmogelijkheden! 5 dagen + €3000 is standaard, indien meer nodig voor opdrachten is dit geen probleem
Laptop naar keuze: macOs, Lunix, Windows...
Socials, meetups, training, hackatons, conferenties…
Vacature
Wij zijn Codebeez, de Python specialisten van Nederland. Dat willen we samen met jou zijn! Bij Codebeez draait het om mensen, om jou! Je krijgt bij Codebeez daadwerkelijk de kans om te helpen het bedrijf op te bouwen, de technische richting te bepalen en er bovenal vanaf het begin bij te zijn!

Heb je ervaring in data gedreven omgevingen als Data Engineer, Data Sciencist of Data Analyst, affiniteit met het ontwerpen en bouwen van Data Pipelines en Machine Learning oplossingen?

Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Je bent meer dan een codeklopper.
Als je toch code gaat kloppen, dan is je code netjes opgebouwd, leesbaar, onderhoudbaar.
Je bent gedreven en wilt jezelf steeds verder ontwikkelen.
Je bent van nature nieuwsgierig naar dingen en mensen. Je kunt (business) doelstellingen achterhalen en zelfstandig oplossingen bedenken, bouwen, testen.

Je kunt en wilt het verschil maken, je staat open voor nieuwe inzichten, je bent kritisch op wat je oplevert, je gaat voor kwaliteit en je deelt graag je kennis. Je bent op zoek naar een omgeving waarin je echt onderdeel uitmaakt van het team en waarin initiatief wordt gewaardeerd. Daarnaast lijkt een startup je ontzettend leuk en ben je bereid te helpen in de opbouw van Codebeez.
Profiel

Ervaring met het ontwerpen en bouwen van Data Pipelines
Ervaring met Machine Learning modellen in productie omgevingen
Ervaring met Software Testing
Werken bij Codebeez
Codebeez zijn wij met z'n allen samen. Wij vormen de cultuur. Op onze eigen manier, die we gezamenlijk bepalen. Alles draait bij Codebeez om onze mensen, hun plezier, hun groei, focus op ons vakgebied en de kwaliteit van wat wij doen. Onze Beez eerst. Een gegeven is dat een bij alleen floreert in een omgeving met overvloedige bloei.

Dat is wat Codebeez biedt; aandacht, vertrouwen, groei, ruimte om mee te denken en samen te bepalen. Wij willen weten wat jou drijft. Wat geeft jou plezier en waar word jij gelukkig van? Daag jezelf uit, handel slim, blijf open, eerlijk en oprecht, denk oneindig, deel en groei samen, werk hard als een bij, maak samen plezier en sprankel!
Doorgroeimogelijkheden
Bij Codebeez wordt er niemand in een hokje gestopt, zo is iedereen binnen het team gelijkwaardig aan elkaar!

Vereisten
Minimaal hbo denk- en werkniveau
Minstens 3 jaar relevante werkervaring als Data Engineer of Software Engineer
Ervaring met C(#/++), Java, Python of Scala
Kennis van en ervaring met Cloud-technologie
Voorkeur voor Agile werken in een DevOps omgeving met Test Driven Development en CI/CD
Aanbod
€7.000-€11.000 (afhankelijk van je ervaring)
32 - 40 uur per week
Goede AOV-verzekering, aanvulling tot €4800 per maand
Onbeperkte vakantiedagen
Tweewekelijkse innovatiesessies overdag
Trainingen en kennissessies
Werkzaamheden
50% Coderen
20% Analyseren
10% Testen
10% Overleg en afstemmen
10% Kennisopbouw en kennisdeling
Vacature
Als Data Engineer gebruik je Data Mining en Machine Learning technieken om de echte waarde uit de ruwe data te halen. Je maakt graag impact met de nieuwste technologieën en gebruikt deze om grote hoeveelheden data te verzamelen, op te slaan en te analyseren. Je kunt je ideeën helder overbrengen op zowel technische als business collega’s.

Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met minstens 2 server-side programmeertalen als C(#/++), Java, Python of Scala. Verder heb je ook kennis van Cloud technologie.
Profiel

Je gebruikt de nieuwste technologieën om grote hoeveelheden data te verzamelen, op te slaan en te analyseren.
Je hebt ervaring met data modellering
Je bent een echte team-player die ownership neemt en gebrand is op continue verbetering
Doorgroeimogelijkheden
Autonomie en zelfsturing staan bij ons voorop als het gaat om de doorgroeimogelijkheden, ook in de keuze van opleidingen!

InnSpire faciliteert de keuzes van de Data Engineers en we maken deze ook fiscaal aftrekbaar.

Hiernaast hebben we 2-wekelijks Innspiratie middagen met variabele onderwerpen.
Werken bij InnSpire
InnSpire faciliteert Data professionals, en stimuleert de ontwikkeling van álle medewerkers. Met technische opleidingen en cursussen, in open source tooling of in tools van onze software partners.

Maar ook met innspiratiemiddagen en trainingen gericht op persoonlijke skills of team vaardigheden. Met riante beloningsmodellen, en flexibele arbeidsvoorwaarden waaruit onze professionals zélf de optimale mix kiezen.

En sámen leren we, sámen vormen we InnSpire en vooral: hebben we veel plezier!

Must-Have
· AWS Certified Developer – Associate or AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate.
· Considerable experience in Developing Data Pipelines and Data Querying (SQL and No-SQL) using native AWS and Marketplace Tools & Services, AWS Data Migration Tools and Services.
· Deep understanding of the ecosystem, including ingestion (e.g. Kafka, Kinesis, Apache Airflow), processing frameworks (e.g. Spark, Flink) and storage engines (e.g. S3, HDFS, HBase, Kudu).
·Considerable experience with programming and scripting skills (PowerShell, Python)
· Considerable Experience building sophisticated and highly automated infrastructure.
· Ability to quickly learn and develop expertise in existing highly complex applications and architectures.
Should-Have
· Deep understanding of DevOps Philosophy plus considerable experience with code pipelines/deployment (Jenkins, Gitlabs and AWS Native tools) and automated testing tools.
· Experience with CloudFormation and/or Terraform.
· Extensive knowledge with high volume distributed application development in cloud environment
Nice-to-Have.
· Deep understanding of AWS cloud native services like Storage, Networking, Security, Databases, Queue and Notification services, API Gateway, Serverless Architecture, Infrastructure-as-a-Code etc.
·Deep Understanding and experience with tagging, tracing and Monitoring.
Job Type: Temporary

Functieomschrijving
Tijdelijk 40 uur/week Utrecht en omgeving z.s.m.
Voor onze eindklant in de omgeving van Utrecht zijn we op zoek naar een Python Data Engineer.
Onze opdrachtgever betreft een wereldwijd opererende organisatie, actief in 70 landen. Als groep is het hun missie om bij te dragen aan de verduurzaming van de wereld door middel van energie (technische) oplossingen. In deze cultuur draait alles om techniek, energie en mensen.
﻿Wat ga je doen?
Bij onze eindklant zijn ze op dit moment bezig met het vormgeven van de dasboards in Palentir op basis van de data vanuit SAP. Binnen deze opdracht ga je je richten op het inrichten van deze dashboards.
Functie-eisen
﻿Je hebt meer dan 3 jaar werkervaring in de rol van Data Engineer;

Je hebt kennis en ervaring met Spark of PySpark;
Je hebt kennis en ervaring met Python, SQL en ETL;
Het is een pré als je ervaring hebt met SAP en Palantir Foundry;
Gedeeltelijk thuiswerken is mogelijk.
Overige informatie
Startdatum: z.s.m.
Inzet: 40 uur/week
Duur: 6 weken met optie op verlenging
Locatie: Utrecht en omgeving

info_remote: De Staffing Groep - Den Bosch - Remote

description:
Professional Job Netherlands, Delft Technology Netherlands
As a Data Engineer within Exact’s Data Science team you have an exciting amount of data being processed every day and an innovative data platform to take care of. This is possible thanks to the smart processing of anonymized data from the more than 550,000 businesses in the Benelux. At Exact, your technical skills and “dare to” mentality, can lead to the best innovations. And where is your career heading? That’s up to you. The career opportunities are unprecedented. 1,850 enterprising colleagues have already paved the way. Are you on board?

This = the job you are looking for
In the Data Science team, we aim to make Exact and its customers smarter, by assisting a data-driven decision-making process via our innovative data platform. The purpose of the data platform is to ingest and process relevant information from all pertinent sources and make quick and reliable insights available to Exact’s products and customers, as well as internal stakeholders.
And that's not all. We can rely on you as a Data Engineer to:
take care of automation and creation off self-healable solutionsmake sure daily jobs are running as expectedproductizing machine learning projects in AWSsupport the internal organization with additional data ingestionsparticipate and contribute to constructive discussions about the architecture and technical aspects of the data platform
This = your team
You will join the 15 colleagues in our multidisciplinary and multicultural Data Science team that includes experts in data scientist, analytics and engineering as part of the Technology organization. They are known for innovative power and smooth cooperation. Asking for help if necessary and offering help if possible is part of their DNA. We have few predefined paths, which gives you plenty of room to choose your own.

Our developers are always looking for ways to improve the products. They this by continuously building and innovating. The annual 48-hour hackathon always results in the development of new ideas and clearly demonstrates the importance of team spirit when building software.

The Data Science department is known for its statistics, engineering and machine learning skills to create AI and analytics functionalities for our customers. This is particularly evident in the exciting amount of data being processed every day and our data platform to handle this.
The main responsibilities of the department are:
Transformation of data into artificial intelligence in Exact’s solutions for our customersGive insights into the customer journey to internal stakeholders
This = what you future colleagues says
While we take work seriously, we also like to have a good time, at work and outside. In normal times – when in the office – we bring a lot of passion to the day. The team likes to do a lot of activities together also outside of the office – during this challenging times with physical distance – the team has adapted and developed their own ways to keep connected by having a fun online gaming session at the end of the week. How often do you get to work hard to keep the wheels turning using the latest technologies and have fun at the same time?
This = what you bring
With us, you can be yourself, and we would love to discover what sets you apart. For the position of Data Engineer it’s helpful if you have a passion for learning and keeping up to date with new technologies and preferably have an eye for quality. What’s more, you bring:
Openness for learning different topics on demandPrevious experience as data engineer/software engineerProgramming skills in Python (.Net core is a plus)Interest into big data processing and ETLsKnowledge of Amazon Web Services Cloud (Azure is a plus)A proponent of clean codeDevOps mentalityCreativity to come up with new ways of transforming/analyzing/ingesting data to expand and improve the scalability of our data pipelines
This = what you get
At Exact, we work hard. And there is something in return. The balance between work and relaxation is very important to us. So once everything gets back to normal, you can work up a sweat in our own gym or take a break at the coffee bar. Empty your head and then tackle your daily tasks with renewed energy. And, of course, that's not all. As a Data Engineer, based on 40 hours per week, you can also count on:

A market conform gross monthly salary;A holiday allowance of 8%;A thirteenth-month bonus;An open-ended employment contract;3 CSR (do good) days;A modern pension scheme;27 holidays;Loyalty days (for every year in service, one additional day with a maximum of five);The best training and coaching so you will develop yourself, personally and professionally;Personal Experimentation Time;An organization that gives you all the room you need;Ambitious colleagues with an eye and passion for IT and innovation;When in the office, a great space with a barista bar and a fitness room.
This = why you shouldn’t wait
If it feels good, don't hesitate. Let us know why you are exactly the right Data Engineer. How you will contribute to the next step of smart processing of business administrations?

If you have any questions about the position and/or the application procedure, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, Linda van Alphen will be happy to answer them via linda.van.alphen@exact.com

This= our application procedure
If we have enough in common, there will first be a telephone intake with the recruiter.
The second step is an interview with the hiring manager and, finally, an in-depth discussion with
both.
A screening and/or a coding or analytical test may be part of the selection process.
This = Exact
Founded in 1984 and now operating in more than 100 countries, we are a leader in the global business and financial software market. What makes us stand out? We combine the energy of a start-up with the advantages of a multinational. Our aim is to create the best business software with the most innovative software solutions. Over 550,000 entrepreneurs and accountants trust our software and use it on a daily basis.

As an employer, we accept our social responsibility. This is important to us and we genuinely believe in it. We think green in everything we do, whether it's by reducing paper consumption, encouraging digital working and minimising travel by plane and car. We also support employees who want to contribute to the (local) community. Exact celebrates differences and views them as a learning opportunity. We assess ideas based on merit, rather than source. It’s passion, dedication and ownership that earn you a place at the table.

post_title: Data Engineer at Division X Data Insights
description:
Are you interested in building data driven services that support decision makers build a sustainable society based on real-world data they can trust?
Right now, we are looking for a Data Engineer to strengthen our team working on products that turn mobile network data into actionable insights.
Is this your next opportunity?
Telia Company has made a strategic bet on transforming itself into a data driven company. One critical step on that transformation journey is creating business value out of data that we have. Our Data Insights team has started this journey by successfully launching a people movement insights offering in Sweden and Finland, currently on its way to more Telia markets. Our Crowd Insights product makes use of Telia network based big data and analytics for producing strictly anonymized insights on people flows, creating customer value by enabling better informed business decisions in many industries.
As a Data Engineer, you will have a central role in implementing robust data pipelines and storage solutions that are capable of handling very large data sets – we currently handle over a billion datapoints per day. You will work with an international team of data scientists and data analysts, using your deep technical knowledge of distributed systems, large data warehouses and cloud architectures to to discover new insights in order to support existing and new Crowd Insights products.
The role includes, but is not limited to:
Participate in ongoing product development activities as well as discussions with the sales team to ensure we can deliver on customer expectations.
Estimate the effort required for your assigned activities and meet deadlines
You will be located in Oslo, Stockholm, Helsinki, or Tallinn. The Data Insights team is at Division X, the emerging business division at Telia, nurturing innovation and spearheading new business opportunities.
Is this you?
You appreciate being a developer and creating insights! In addition, you find it extra exciting with data and data transformation. You put a lot of pride in your code, and think interaction with others is important for your own and your colleagues' development. You enjoy taking responsibility and think simplification is something to work for. We are a good mix of people and are looking for you who are not only good at what you do, but who can add positive energy to the team.
We think you recognize yourself with:
Passionate about data and solid problem solving skills
Collaborator
Enjoy exploration and building something new
Your experience:
Proven experience in using SQL, Pything or R in the context of big data applications
Full professional verbal- and written proficiency in English
It’s more than just a job!
Regardless of the position you are looking for, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both as a professional and as a person, with us. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. We respect and value the diversity of people. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits.
Interested?
If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job you are welcome to contact me at simo.veikkolainen@teliacompany.com.
We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. Application deadline is 2022-05-22.
Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!

post_title: Data Engineer innen personalisering og kundedata
description:
Vi ser etter en Data Engineer og dyktig utvikler som brenner for å skape gode kundeopplevelser gjennom bruk av data, teknologi og kundeinnsikt til vår avdeling Personalisering og Datadrevet Kundebetjening. I denne rollen vil du ha ansvar for å definere og levere data gjennom bruk av teknologi slik at vi kan tilby våre kunder den beste og mest relevante kundeopplevelsen på tvers av kanaler. 
Om jobben Du vil bruke teknologien til å samle inn og anvende data, og rollen vil dermed innebære at du jobber operasjonelt med både data og utvikling. Du vil være en faglig spydspiss innen tilrettelegging og bruk av data og teknologi til personalisering og analyse, og dine hovedoppgaver vil være:

Utvikle og legge frem løsningsforslag for bruk av data og teknologi til personalisering og analyse på tvers av kanaler og plattformer i Gjensidige
Utvikle, teste og drifte Gjensidiges teknologi for data og personalisering
Definere og levere data inn i operasjonell drift
Etablere og ivareta løsninger for datafangst, datakvalitet, samt overvåking av plattformene og integrasjoner
Være en pådriver for at Gjensidige skal benytte mulighetene som finnes innen bruk av kundedata og personalisering samt drive leveranser og initiativer på dette området
Bistå forretningsområdene med innsikt i, tilrettelegging og bruk av data


 Om deg Du er brennende engasjert i bruk av data og teknologi for å gi den relevante kundeopplevelsen og ønsker å bidra til at Gjensidige skal være helt fremst i utviklingen innen disse områdene. Vi ønsker deg som har følgende kvalifikasjoner og egenskaper:

Relevant utdanning på Bachelor- eller Masternivå, innen IT, analyse, matematikk eller økonomi
Relevant arbeidserfaring
Erfaring med datainnsamling, databaser, datakvalitet og integrasjoner til bruk for personalisering av kundeopplevelser i digitale og betjente kundeflater
Erfaring med programmering innen python, javascript og SQL
Erfaring med machine learning, kafka samt fangst og bruk av sanntidsdata er en fordel
God kjennskap til konfigurasjon av verktøy for datafangst og personalisering som Celebrus, Teradata, Salesforce, SAS eller liknende
Erfaring fra prosjektledelse eller fra å drive leveranser
God forretningsforståelse
Er strukturert, løsningsorientert og fremoverlent
Gode samarbeidsevner og liker å jobbe i team
God muntlig og skriftlig fremstillingsevne på norsk og engelsk


 Vi tilbyr blant annet:

De beste kollegene
En virksomhet som satser på utvikling av medarbeiderne
Konkurransedyktige betingelser med særlig god pensjonsspareordning
Gode forsikringsordninger
Firmahytter i inn- og utland
Aksjespareordning
Treningsmuligheter i eget treningsstudio samt bedriftsidrettslag
Arbeidssted i fine lokaler sentralt i Oslo (5 minutters gange fra Oslo S)

Tenk nytt på karrieren din, og ta sats! - så sørger vi for at det skjer i trygge rammer.
I Gjensidige ønsker vi å gjenspeile bredden av mangfoldet i samfunnet, og den du er er viktig for oss. Hos oss får alle like stor plass, og mangfoldet vårt beriker både oss selv og kundene våre. Gjennom å være deg selv, og få muligheten til å utvikle ditt fulle potensial, kan du utnytte evnene dine langt bedre. Vi har gått bort i fra det tradisjonelle søknadsbrevet og ønsker at du svarer på noen utvalgte spørsmål, i tillegg til at du laster opp CVn din

ALTEN Group is a major technological partner of global customers and has become in 30 years the leading European provider of Engineering and Technology Consulting (ECT). With over 37.000 employees (including 88% engineers), present in 30 countries and revenues exceeding €2 billion, supports its customers’ development strategies in the fields of innovation, R&D, and IT systems.
Join ALTEN Polska and let’s grow high added value to engineering, IT, and consulting services. We were awarded the title Best Workplaces Poland 2021 and the „Ethics Standard Advocate” award, granted by the United Nations Global Compact Network Poland.

Data Engineer with Kafka
Let us introduce you the job offer by EY GDS Poland – a member of the global integrated service delivery center network by EY.
The opportunity
We are looking for a top-notch technology savvy specialists willing to move our projects on the new track! You will use the most advanced technology stack and have an opportunity to implement new solutions while working with top leaders in their industries.
Your key responsibilities
As a Data Engineer with Kafka you will be responsible for building robust data streaming platforms. You will implement efficient solutions using large amount of data from various sources.
Skills and attributes for success
Solving complex business problems at large scale. Participating in a cross-functional initiatives and collaborating across various domains. Interacting with data engineers, product/project managers and partners from all over the world.
To qualify for the role, you must have
3+ years of commercial experience in similar role
Experience in Apache Kafka: Connect API, Streams API
Experience in SQL
Proficiency in Python / Spark
Understanding of Distributed Data Processing of big data batch or streaming pipelines
Hands-on experience with cloud orchestration and automation tools
Understanding of data Modelling and data Concepts like data warehouse, marts etc.
Very good English (verbal and written)
Experience with version control system (GIT, Azure Devops, SVN)
Ideally, you’ll also have
Other streaming platforms like: Spark streaming, Azure Stream Analytics, Apache Flink etc.
Experience with Big Data technology
Experience in using Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Experience in enterprise-class solution implementations
What we look for
As we are a dynamic team of passionate specialists, and we work in international teams all over the world, we will look for the same business acumen. Facing with customers, we are 'out of box thinking' professionals. Our top performers have a team player attitude and they cope with challenges on the daily basis. If it all sounds familiar to you - we are looking forward to seeing you on board.
What we offer
EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations – Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland and the UK – and with teams from all EY service lines, geographies and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
About EY
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Senior Data Engineer
Let us introduce you the job offer by EY GDS Poland – a member of the global integrated service delivery center network by EY.
The opportunity
Leads the delivery of processes to extract, transform and load data from disparate sources into a form that is consumable by analytics processes, for projects with moderate complexity, using strong technical capabilities
Designs, develops and produces data models of relatively high complexity, leveraging a sound understanding of data modelling standards to ensure high quality
Builds networks with other departments across the business to help define and deliver business value, and may interface and communicate with program teams, management and stakeholders as required to deliver small to medium-sized projects
Your key responsibilities
Leading the production of high-quality data engineering deliverables, helping to ensure project timelines are met, and providing informal mentoring / training to junior members of the team
Leading the delivery of data quality reviews including data cleansing where required to ensure integrity and quality
Leading the delivery of data models, data storage models and data migration to manage data within the organization, for a small to medium-sized project
Resolving escalated design and implementation issues with moderate to high complexity
Analyzing the latest industry trends such as cloud computing and distributed processing and beginning to infer risks and benefits of their use in business
Providing technical expertise to maximize value from current applications, solutions, infrastructure and emerging technologies and seek to continuously improve internal processes
Developing working relationships with peers across other engineering teams and beginning to collaborate to develop leading data engineering solutions
Driving adherence to the relevant data engineering and data modelling processes, procedures and standards
Skills and attributes for success
Batch Processing - Capability to design an efficient way of processing high volumes of data where a group of transactions is collected over a period of time
Data Integration (Sourcing, Storage and Migration) - Capability to design and implement models, capabilities and solutions to manage data within the enterprise (structured and unstructured, data archiving principles, data warehousing, data sourcing, etc.). This includes the data models, storage requirements and migration of data from one system to another
Data Quality, Profiling and Cleansing - Capability to review (profile) a data set to establish its quality against a defined set of parameters and to highlight data where corrective action (cleansing) is required to remediate the data
Stream Systems - Capability to discover, integrate, and ingest all available data from the machines that produce it, as fast as it’s produced, in any format, and at any quality
To qualify for the role, you must have
B.S. in Actuarial, Behavior Economics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Econometrics, Engineering, IT, Cyber Security, or related field preferredExperience designing and building Data Platforms integrating disparate data sources
Knowledge of distributed computing
Expertise in ETL, SQL
Expertise working with MPP solutions to deal with massive amounts of data
Expertise in Azure, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL, Synapse
Expertise developing dataflows using NiFi/ADF, Databricks
Advanced, hands-on experience implementing large scale data warehouses and data lakes
Advanced, hands-on experience in Spark architecture and implementation
Experience working with Distributed Message Systems like Kafka
Hands on experience in Python, PySpark or R
Knowledge of working with structured and unstructured data sources
Expert in writing complex SQL and procedures
Knowledge or creating ingestion workflows using Oozie or similar tools
Knowledge of security measures like HTTPS and Kerberos
Ideally, you’ll also have
Knowledge in Graph Databases, preferably Neo4J, Cypher and Cosmos DB
Graph Data Modeling
Azure Data Lake Store, Databricks Delta lakes
Spark ML
Experience developing Microservices
What we look for
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability
A self-starter, independent-thinker, curious and creative person with ambition and passion
Excellent inter-personal, communication, collaboration, and presentation skills
Customer focused
Excellent time management skills
Positive and constructive minded
Takes responsibility for continuous self-learning
Takes the lead and makes decisions in critical times and tough circumstances
Attention to detail
High levels of integrity and honesty
What we offer
EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations – Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland and the UK – and with teams from all EY service lines, geographies and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
About EY
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Enterprise Technology has created a new AI R&D unit at Accenture Global IT. The team is currently looking for a talented and passionate Data Engineer.
Why is working with us interesting?
Are you interested in joining a team that will push a Tech Vision across the enterprise over the next 5 years?
We’re innovators, researchers, and concept designers. We investigate emerging technologies to identify upcoming trends around Analytics, AI, and Big Data and then apply them to new business models within Accenture.
What would be my role?
As a Data Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in an exciting and dynamic environment. You will be responsible for the creation of forward-thinking and disruptive concepts, ideas, roadmaps, and prototypes.
Who you´ll work with…
You´ll work closely with various internal teams and group´s Strategy leaders to shape Accenture´s future around AI/ML and Advanced Analytics. The results of you work will transform and disrupt the way how data is being used within the company at a global scale.
We are part of CIO family called Enterprise Technology – Vision and Strategy that exists to shape Accenture´s internal Technology future.

What we are looking for…MSc program or university degree (preferably in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, or Computer Science)Hands-on Java, Python, C#, Spark, SQL, and Linux.Ability to write complex SQL queries to extract data from a data lakeHands-on Azure data engineering related services from major cloud vendorsExperience building fault-tolerant, scalable batch, and real-time distributed data processing systems and associated technology in the cloudExperience processing and transforming unstructured/structured data at scale in optimal ways (cost/performance)Ability to optimize performance and resource utilization on large, big data cloud production environmentsExperience building and working with RESTful APIs and/or data streamingKnowledge of relational, nonrelational databases, data modeling, and big data frameworksProficient English (written/verbal communication skills)
What would also help…Data Engineer certificationExperience analyzing big data in magnitudes of terabytes /petabytes - preferably coming from ITSM logs, events, and IoT tools at scaleEnjoy discovering, testing, and researching new big data technologies and being able to share results and best practices via whitepapers, blogs, townhalls...General understanding of Knowledge about Data Mining, Statistics and Machine Learning.Understanding technologies like digital twin, IoT, and virtual reality.Experience in deploying microservices such as Kubernetes, docker...Basic understanding of Agile and Design Thinking methodologies.General knowledge about Agile and DevOps, MLOps and AIOps frameworks.
What you can expect…Being an integral part of an innovative organization that explores and tests cutting edge technologyJoining a team that invests in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, mentorships, conferences, and an O'Reilly/Pluralsight subscription)Having fun and working with a multicultural team that is dedicated to ensuring a positive work/life balanceFlexible working from home/officeWork from home support (mindfulness tools, flexible working hours, VR events)

Moss is the modern corporate credit card and spends management platform. We are a group of serial entrepreneurs and fintech experts driven by our mission to enable businesses to master their finances. After solidifying a total of €130 million in funding, we continue to pave the way for next-generation B2B spending, empowering our customers to make informed cash flow decisions. To this day we have 100’s of live customers, were awarded Fintech of the year in 2020, and have a team in place with experience building out foundations of numerous successful Fintech companies. 
 
 As we are scaling, we are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data team\_\_ with innovative thinkers and contributors! Along with them, you will develop, enhance and maintain our web application platform and play a pivotal role in developing our product.

Experience in working independently with ETL
Experience with Python, SQL/PostgreSQL
Working experience with Linux environment
Extensive hands-on experience with data integration and data quality control
Ability to become a bridge between data and engineering
Product mindset and interest in being a part of the product roadmap decision making
Experience in our tech stack: Google cloud, Salesforce platform, Google data stack, Machine learning ops
 What you will be working on 
 


Enable data-driven decision making in the Go to Market team and have a real, tenable impact on its strategy
Managing data integration and data quality control processes

 What we offer 
 


A competitive compensation package including early-stage equity
Join an experienced highly motivated and fast-moving team
The ability to shape the product success within the market of a quickly growing startup
Learning & Development budget

The hardware you need to do the job in the best way possible
Contribute to and share the company's success\_\_

We are looking for a Data Engineer to work on production and R&D projects in the business space of logistics, partnering closely with a team of data scientists, performing the development of new features, maintenance, optimization & functional prototyping using modern tools in a cloud-based environment.
You will be joining a new, growing team and will have the unique opportunity to help shape the future. The products that we work on already significantly impact the company’s business and their impact is growing week after week.
Responsibilities:
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements and develop associated data layers that can easily be consumed by data science applications.
Partner with the data science team to prepare structured and unstructured data that they can use for predictive and prescriptive modeling.
Implement & modify existing ETL/ELT processes that allow for system auditing & monitoring
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure in collaboration with stakeholders
Work in a rapid prototyping area where the ability to pivot is a must
Required qualifications:
Proficiency with relational databases & SQL
Experience with object-oriented programming – preferably in Python
2+ years of experience with big data platforms or NoSQL databases (minimum one of the following) – Snowflake / Hadoop / Spark / Elasticsearch / MongoDB / Redis
Proficiency with Git, or comparable distributed version control system
Experience with using modern CI/CD pipelines
Preferred qualifications:
Experience with ELT/ETL building tools - preferably Apache Airflow
Docker and container orchestration experience (Kubernetes, Mesos)
Familiarity building stream-processing systems, preferably with Kafka
Familiarity with API creation and RESTful services
Interest in learning new technologies and languages
Ability to be resourceful and creative in a fast-paced daily release environment
What does C.H. Robinson offer you?
Contract of employment + package of benefits (private medical care/ multi cafeteria program/annual bonus 10%).
Work office in Warsaw Spire, near to metro station Rondo Daszyńskiego.
Language lessons in small groups.
An opportunity to use and develop your language skills in our international work environment.
Working in a new team, which we are building from scratch in Warsaw, in close cooperation with the US team.
Why Do You Belong at C.H. Robinson?
Standing out among the world’s largest logistics platforms, C.H. Robinson solves logistics problems for companies across the globe and across industries, from the simple to the most complex. For 100+ years, our global suite of services has innovated trade to seamlessly deliver the products and goods that drive the world’s economy. With 19 million shipments annually for 105,000 customers, our people and technology literally move the world.
As a FORTUNE 200 company, FORTUNE has also named C.H. Robinson one of the World’s Most Admired Companies 2022. Headquartered in Eden Prairie, Minnesota, we are proud to be recognized as one of LinkedIn’s Top Companies in Minneapolis-St. Paul 2021. And we’re not stopping there… Join us as we collaborate, innovate, and work as one global team to make life better and more sustainable for our customers, communities, and world.

Poznaj Onwelo:

Onwelo to nowoczesna polska spółka technologiczna, która specjalizuje się w budowaniu innowacyjnych rozwiązań IT dla organizacji z szeregu sektorów na całym świecie. Główne obszary działalności Onwelo to: tworzenie oprogramowania, jego rozwój oraz utrzymanie, a także mocne wsparcie kompetencyjne. W krótkim czasie firma wdrożyła ponad 300 projektów w Europie i w USA, powiększyła zespół do ponad 400 osób, a także otworzyła biura w sześciu miastach Polski oraz oddziały w Stanach Zjednoczonych, Niemczech i w Szwajcarii.


Poszukujemy dociekliwych i nastawionych na rozwój osób, które chcą pracować w obszarze DWH i Business Intelligence. Zespół Data & Analytics odpowiada za rozwój produktów z wykorzystaniem najnowszych technologii, takich jak narzędzia Amazon Web Services, Snowflake, Qlik, Power BI i inne rozwiązania Data Analytics.

Z nami będziesz:

Przeprowadzać analizę danych i projektować modele danych
Implementować zaprojektowane rozwiązania w procedurach składowanych w Snowflake
Przygotowywać raporty i analizy ad hoc
Współpracować z biznesem oraz innymi działami przy zbieraniu danych niezbędnych do opracowywania intuicyjnych i praktycznych rozwiązań w zakresie analizy wizualnej i raportowania
Zdobywać doświadczenie i rozwijać się jako deweloper w obszarze hurtowni danych
Pracować z najnowszymi technologiami w międzynarodowym środowisku

Czekamy na Ciebie, jeśli:

Masz minimum 3 lat doświadczenia w realizacji projektów z zakresu wdrażania, rozwoju czy utrzymania hurtowni danych lub dużych baz relacyjnych
Posiadasz ponad 3 lata praktycznego doświadczenia w tworzeniu złożonych zapytań SQL
Masz praktyczne doświadczenie w pisaniu procedur w Snowflake
Posiadasz wyższe wykształcenie techniczne
Masz bardzo dobre umiejętności komunikacyjne i analityczne
Komunikujesz się w języku angielskim na poziomie min. B2
Mile widziane:
Doświadczenie pracy z narzędziami Amazon Web Services
Programowanie w języku Python

Dowiedz się, jak skorzystasz, będąc w Onwelo:

Wybierzesz wygodną dla Ciebie formę zatrudnienia
Otrzymasz możliwość korzystania z elastycznych godzin pracy
Potrzebujesz pracować zdalnie? Jesteśmy otwarci!
Zaoszczędzisz czas na dojazdach – pracuj w naszym atrakcyjnie zlokalizowanym biurze w jednym z 6 miast w Polsce
Rozwiniesz swoje umiejętności, współpracując z doświadczonymi ekspertami
Będziesz pracować z wykorzystaniem nowych technologii
Uzyskasz dostęp do szkoleń wewnętrznych i zewnętrznych
Weźmiesz udział w ciekawych projektach dla polskich i międzynarodowych klientów
Otrzymasz możliwość wyjazdu za granicę, jeżeli jesteś mobilny zawodowo
Będzie na Ciebie czekać przyjazne i komfortowe środowisko pracy
Integracje firmowe pozwolą Ci na bliższe poznanie zespołu
Zabezpieczysz swoją przyszłość, korzystając z dodatkowego ubezpieczenia na życie
Z prywatną opieką medyczną zadbasz o zdrowie swoje i swoich bliskich

Awareson is IT Recruitment Consultancy specializing in delivery of IT Specialists on contract and permanent basis to Customers across Europe.

Work Styles at Zoom
In most cases, you will have the opportunity to choose your preferred working location from the following options when you join Zoom: in-person, hybrid or remote. Visit this page for more information about Zoom's Workstyles.
About Us
Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.
We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
You will be part of a team whose focus is to solve cutting edge AI / MLproblems and deploy models that constantly advance the state-of-the-art. You will be working on designing the data infrastructure and solve other interesting bottlenecks that are challenging at Zoom's scale.

Responsibilities :
Design and implementation of data infrastructure for Machine Learning (ML) projects for our Research and Development Org
Assembling large, complex data sets and make the data more discoverable and easy to be used by the AI / ML team to support various Machine Learning initiatives. This includes unifying pre-processing work flows for data for different AI tasks.
Build and manage data sets, also by identifying and using suitable big data technologies, such as Apache Hadoop, DVC, Apache Drill,
Write tools to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models by coding across several languages such as Python, and SQL
Deploy, develop and maintain tools for data collection, data crawling and data annotation, e.g. as web applications using Django and Angular or similar technology.
Along with looking at external sources of data, build data expertise and own data quality for the pipelines you create.
Requirements :
Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields
Experience in building and optimising data pipelines
DockerExperience with AWS cloud services, e.g. S3Experience working with large data volumesBroad knowledge of the data infrastructure ecosystemKnowledge of technologies like DVC or HadoopGood understanding of one or more of the following : Python, JavaScript, C++, Django or Angular

Please note : This job opportunity is based out of Karlsruhe, Germany

description:
Poland, Lesser Poland

18000 to 25000 PLN
Engineer Role
Skills: Analytical skills, familiarity with technologies, data visualization skills, AWS Glue experience
Level: Senior

Job description
Global Data Engineer
220422EC8


Global Data Engineer


Job Description Summary

Responsible for designing, developing, testing and implementing data engineering processes to generate analytical and reporting solutions. Responsible for managing and maintaining metadata data structures besides providing necessary support for post-deployment related activities when needed. Accountable to deliver results in a timely manner using agile methodologies. Provide essential work which will revolutionise and make life saving impacts in the medical industry.




Roles and Responsibilities

In this role, you will:
Build technical data dictionaries and support business glossaries to analyze the datasets
Perform data profiling and data analysis for source systems, manually maintained data, machine generated data and target data repositories
Build both logical and physical data models
Develop and maintain data mapping specifications based on the results of data analysis and functional requirements
Perform a variety of data loads & data transformations using multiple tools and technologies.
Build and maintain automated Extract, Transform & Load (ETL) jobs
Analyze reference datasets and familiarize with Master Data Management (MDM) tools.
Analyze the impact of downstream systems and products
Derive solutions and make recommendations from deep dive data analysis.
Design and build Data Quality (DQ) rules needed
Cooperate with business stakeholders, Product Owner, Technical Product Manager, Delivery Lead and Data Architect using Agile methodology


Required qualifications:
Technical background with minimum 5 years of experience in ETL and data processing
Minimum 1 year experience of development in AWS environment (PySpark, AWS Glue, Step Function, Lambda, Redshift or other)
Exposure to Extract, Transform & Load (ETL) tools like Informatica or Talend
Hands-on experience in writing SQL scripts for Teradata, AWS, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL or HiveQL
Exposure to unstructured datasets and ability to handle Parquet, CSV, XML or JSON file formats
Exploratory data analysis and generation of visual summaries of data. Identify data quality issues proactively.


Preferred experience:
Exposure to industry standard data catalog, automated data discovery and data lineage tools (e.g., Alation, Collibra, TAMR etc., )
Experience with Big Data / Hadoop / Spark / Hive / NoSQL database engines (i.e. Cassandra or HBase)
Exposure to Digital Marketing, SEO/SEM, Social Media, Orders or Sales data
Knowledge of industrial applications in a global supply chain/commercial/finance/industrial or manufacturing settings.
Exposure to finance and accounting data domains
Knowledge of Adobe, Marketo, Reltio, online chat systems

post_title: Senior - Cloud Data Engineer - Azure | Lisbon Office

description:
About CameraMatics
We are a fast growing start-up with an award-winning SaaS solution for fleet and driver risk management.
CameraMatics SafeDrive is a disruptive technology in an exciting phase of growth as we continue to expand our business operations and reach new markets across the world.
We provide a service based on camera technology, vision systems, AI, Machine Learning and Telematics, that helps fleet operators to drive new safety standards across their fleet and drivers, reduce accidents, improve operational efficiencies, manage compliance, whilst giving them complete visibility and peace of mind for today’s challenges in fleet operations.
At CameraMatics you will find an exciting opportunity to work for a young dynamic tech company with team members all across the world. Our culture fosters open and collaborative environments where our team and individual accomplishments are celebrated and encouraged. We work together as a friendly and supportive team who are willing to assist each other and share best practices to achieve team success.

Role and Responsibilities
You will provide core, hands-on, technical software development contributions within the data platform team responsible for building, maintaining and supporting all data assets and services to meet the needs of our development teams in building new features for users.
The data engineer will work closely with our frontend, firmware and platform engineers to build and deploy scalable, robust new features for our customers.
This role requires someone who can both architect new features and functionality while being able to implement, develop and support deployments into production.

Develop and improve existing data services as well as identifying opportunities for improved efficiency and performance.
Investigate and resolve issues arising from the data backend platform services.
Architect, design and implement features in line with new products and platform road maps.
Work as part of a cross functional team in collaborative design and development projects serving as advisor and influencer in the area of data engineering.
Ensure that all aspects of your development work conform to industry best practices in line with aspects of CI/CD and TDD.

To be considered for this position you must have

Bachelor's degree in the fields of IT, Science, Technology, Engineering or Maths or equivalent practical experience in a relevant field.
Experience in understanding, writing and debugging code in Python, additional experience in Java, Scala or C++ will be an advantage.
Experience in cloud computing and in-depth knowledge of AWS Lambda, RDS, Glue (Apache Spark), Kinesis (Kafka), DynamoDB (No Sql Modelling) and Kinesis Data Analytics (Apache Flink)
Understanding of data structures and algorithms.
Troubleshooting database performance.
Schema design and data modelling (relational and non-relational)
Experience with cloud based serverless storage and development tools.
Development of products and services to the point of production.
Communication skills and experience working in a distributed team in accordance with agile principles.

Package Details
Opportunity to be creative and play a key role in the success of a high-growth future unicorn!

Competitive salary + Performance Bonus
Share options
Further educational assistance
22 days paid holiday
Career Progression
Health Insurance Allowance
Hybrid working option
What is the Hiring Process?
Applicants who do not meet the application requirements will not be considered at the shortlist stage.
Suitable candidates for the position can expect the following hiring process:

Suitable applicants will be invited for an interview to get to know one another.
Successful candidates will be invited to a second stage of the interview process to build a deeper connection, and may be requested to complete an assessment.
Successful candidates will be contacted with an offer to join our team.
CameraMatics is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications. While CameraMatics supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunities may be limited to certain roles and skillsets.

Enterprise Technology has created a new AI R&D unit at Accenture Global IT. The team is currently looking for a talented and passionate Data Engineer.
Why is working with us interesting?
Are you interested in joining a team that will push a Tech Vision across the enterprise over the next 5 years?
We’re innovators, researchers, and concept designers. We investigate emerging technologies to identify upcoming trends around Analytics, AI, and Big Data and then apply them to new business models within Accenture.
What would be my role?
As a Data Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in an exciting and dynamic environment. You will be responsible for the creation of forward-thinking and disruptive concepts, ideas, roadmaps, and prototypes.
Who you´ll work with…
You´ll work closely with various internal teams and group´s Strategy leaders to shape Accenture´s future around AI/ML and Advanced Analytics. The results of you work will transform and disrupt the way how data is being used within the company at a global scale.
We are part of CIO family called Enterprise Technology – Vision and Strategy that exists to shape Accenture´s internal Technology future.

What we are looking for…MSc program or university degree (preferably in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, or Computer Science)Hands-on Java, Python, C#, Spark, SQL, and Linux.Ability to write complex SQL queries to extract data from a data lakeHands-on Azure data engineering related services from major cloud vendorsExperience building fault-tolerant, scalable batch, and real-time distributed data processing systems and associated technology in the cloudExperience processing and transforming unstructured/structured data at scale in optimal ways (cost/performance)Ability to optimize performance and resource utilization on large, big data cloud production environmentsExperience building and working with RESTful APIs and/or data streamingKnowledge of relational, nonrelational databases, data modeling, and big data frameworksProficient English (written/verbal communication skills)

What would also help…Data Engineer certificationExperience analyzing big data in magnitudes of terabytes /petabytes - preferably coming from ITSM logs, events, and IoT tools at scaleEnjoy discovering, testing, and researching new big data technologies and being able to share results and best practices via whitepapers, blogs, townhalls...General understanding of Knowledge about Data Mining, Statistics and Machine Learning.Understanding technologies like digital twin, IoT, and virtual reality.Experience in deploying microservices such as Kubernetes, docker...Basic understanding of Agile and Design Thinking methodologies.General knowledge about Agile and DevOps, MLOps and AIOps frameworks.
What you can expect…Being an integral part of an innovative organization that explores and tests cutting edge technologyJoining a team that invests in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, mentorships, conferences, and an O'Reilly/Pluralsight subscription)Having fun and working with a multicultural team that is dedicated to ensuring a positive work/life balanceFlexible working from home/officeWork from home support (mindfulness tools, flexible working hours, VR events)

_VOIS:
_VOIS (Vodafone Intelligent Solutions) is a strategic arm of Vodafone Group Plc, creating value and enhancing quality and efficiency across 28 countries, and operating from 7 locations: Albania, Egypt, Hungary, India, Romania, Turkey and the UK. Established in 2006, _VOIS has evolved into a global, multi-functional organisation with more than 26,000 professionals supporting Vodafone’s global markets.
_VOIS Romania:
In 2014, _VOIS started operating in Romania from its global delivery center in Bucharest. With more than 2,700 employees, _VOIS Romania supports global markets and group functions of Vodafone, and delivers best-in-class customer experience through multi-functional services in the areas of Information Technology, Networks, Business Intelligence and Analytics, Digital Business Solutions (Robotics & AI), Commercial Operations (Consumer & Business), Intelligent Operations, Finance Operations, Supply Chain Operations and HR Operations and more.
Our employees have helped us get certified as a Great Place to Work organization. This recognition positions us among a select group of trustworthy and high performing companies which put their employees at the heart of everything they do.

At _VOIS, we’re restless and passionate about creating a better future. A more inclusive, and more sustainable world. Being part of Vodafone’s 100k+ global workforce, we provide our people challenging global assignments and the opportunities to apply for roles across 30+ global markets of Vodafone.
Our groundbreaking gender-neutral parental leave programmes promote balance and equality for birthing & non-birthing parents.
We are committed to providing our people with a career for life and we believe in supporting our people throughout different stages of their lives with our Youth, ReConnect and state of the art upskilling programmes.
Our focus on being 100%Human and supporting mental health and wellbeing creates a culture of trust, balance and productivity.
We are committed to positively impacting the lives of more than 500,000 people by providing skills, learning and employment opportunities by end of 2025 as part of our global outreach programmes.
Your day to day:
The opportunity to make part of an international and multicultural team, this great team supports the best Pan European TV service and delivers the best entertainment to our customers. This role has the intention to create, implement and support automations based, on Tv platforms usage data in order to help the operations team to take faster and better decisions, make the day-to-day work simpler and the service greater.
With these activities you will have a great impact on our business:Test, Operate and Demand Machine Learning and AI models that are scaled and replicated across TV marketsUse a variety of datasets to test hypothesis, discover hidden relationships and provide actionable insightsTest, Operate analytical models to industrialise insight into TV OperationsUse data visualisation to engage audiences in a compelling way
With these activities you will have a great impact on our business:Ability to transform user and operational requirements to create actionable operational insights via meaningful dashboards, alarms, reports, automation workflows, etcMonitor overall delivery of data to different data platforms and assist with troubleshooting when needed.Support data quality practices, identify discrepancies, anomalies and flaws in the dataExperience manipulating and analysing large and complex datasetsStrong communication skills to manage local and remote stakeholders in a highly distributed teamProfessional work experience with data, analytics, BIProficient in flow programming tools e.g Apache Nifi , AlteryxStrong know in business intelligence and reporting tools and capabilities e.g Splunk, Kibana, Tableau, ExcelExperienced in MongoDB and OracleDBStrong skills in Automation tools or automation via Python programmingGood knowledge in Docker/Podman, LinuxKnowledge in machine learning algorithms and NLP will be appreciatedBasic knowledge of AWS platform is preferred.
#_VOIS is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We celebrate differences and we welcome and value diverse people and insights. By joining us, you are part of our commitment. We look forward to welcoming you into our family that represents a variety of cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and skills!

Innovation starts with being curious.
At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable and convenient mobility. Want to join us?


What's in it for you?
Would you like to influence and craft the technical strategy that helps Volvo Cars to grow and reach our goal of being an electric car company by 2030?
Excellent, then we would like you to join our Cluster as Senior Data Engineer!

The Data & Identity Cluster is a part of the Global Online Experience (GOX) area and our mission is to ensure we know our customers well and keep this information safe and secure. We support the rest of the organization in using this knowledge to serve the customers in the best possible way. We’re looking for someone that will help us craft a world-class data ecosystem that spans across multiple product teams and clusters. We have only just begun this journey in earnest, and you’ll be joining us at a time where you can really have a great impact and help us set the tone for the next chapter in our company's history!

What you'll do
As an early joiner in a new team within a highly prioritized area, you will play a key role in setting technical direction and building a world-class data architecture based on Data Mesh principles.

Work in a multi-functional agile team to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on product objectives
Leverage our large and diverse datasets to enable use cases with direct impact on the end customer's digital experience
Work with state-of-the-art data processing frameworks, technologies, and cloud platforms
Develop in different technologies and languages ranging from Java and Scala to Python and SQL
Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve data quality
Increase developer productivity by building innovative tools that reduce the maintenance overhead of working with data pipelines and help increase platform reliability
Advocate and advance modern, agile software development and help develop and foster good engineering practices
Demonstrate and champion an appetite for knowledge and never stop developing as a Data Engineer

You and your skills
You are deeply knowledgeable and passionate about modern data architecture principles specialized in either the Data Lake or Data Warehouse tech stack
You know and care about sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing
You care about and have experience with agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation
You are passionate about crafting clean code and have a steady foundation in coding and building data pipelines in a cloud-based environment
You are knowledgeable about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques
You know how to write distributed, high-volume services in Java, Scala, or Python and are well versed in the SQL language and databases
You understand the value of collaboration and partnership within a team
You like to have fun at work and take great care in making sure everyone always feels welcome and included!
You fully embrace a growth mindset and encourage others to do the same

We offer our employees excellent benefits such as:
Plenty of leave to let you take time off for what's most important in life.
Collective Agreement and ITP pensions.
An annual allowance to spend on your health and wellbeing.
Private health insurance.

How to learn more and apply
Please note that applications via email will not be accepted due to GDPR. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Ellinor Magnusson, Lead Recruiter - Engineering via ellinor.maagnusson@volvocars.com.

Who are we?
Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

AWS Data Engineer- Malmö, Sweden
Full time
Malmö, Stockholm, Sweden
Job Languages:
English

Job summary
The AWS Data Engineer will deliver high-quality data pipelines on the Bank Data Platform. As these are our first steps in our AWS journey, there is a big possibility to contribute to how we work, how we build and how we ensure quality.

The AWS Data Engineer will work in close collaboration with the AWS Data Engineer Lead, other Data Engineers and Data Analysts, implementing well-performing, re-usable code with a high degree of quality.

Key Responsibilities:
– Developing high-quality data pipelines, making data available on the Bank Data Platform.
– Create reusable components and enhance existing flows and components.
– Provide documentation at the right level, to help others understand and support what you have built.
– As we work in a DevOps fashion – be responsible for what you build and for the deliveries of the team as a whole.

Skills:
– Extensive knowledge of the AWS platform.
– Extensive knowledge of the AWS Data Lake-related services, i.e. AWS Glue, AWS S3, AWS Athena, AWS Select and AWS Lambda.
– Good knowledge of Kafka integration.
– Good knowledge of data modelling.
– Good knowledge or relational databases.
– Knowledge and experience from the development of Data Lakes in AWS, using AWS technologies.
– Experience with ELT/ETL tools and processing.
– Experience with data lake concepts.
– Experience working with data quality.
– Experience working with Bank/Finance is an advantage

Additional information
– When applying, include your hourly rate and possible start date
– Clearly motivate how you meet the qualification
Apply Online

Categories
Data & IT, Technology

Location
Stockholm

Data Engineer to SEB Technology
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes an enormous impact on our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?
What you will be doing
Data is an especially valuable resource for SEB’s journey ahead, and you will be working with important types of deliveries and business areas. SEB is undergoing a major change in how we handle and make use of our data, and you will have a significant impact on defining this journey ahead!
As a Data Engineer at SEB, you will be handling interesting technical problems and be a part of SEBs change journey becoming a truly data driven bank using modern tools and ways of working. You will be handling substantial amounts of data and using different modern tools, such as GCP (Google Cloud Platform), Kafka, Spark and Terraform. As a Data Engineer here at SEB you will also be involved in various data driven initiatives which create value for our customers.
Who are you?
You enjoy working with substantial amounts of data and how to handle and make use of it. You like to work in teams and projects that involve machine learning and advanced analytics. We are looking for a person who has systematic thinking and can solve different problems with different solutions. The most important thing is that you are motivated and that you think it is fun to present and share your results within the team and the bank.
To thrive in this position, we believe you have a background in software engineering and are fluent withing some programming languages such as Python, Java or Scala. It is also a big advantage if you have any experience working with databases andbig data technologies such asSpark and Kafka, but if not, we are happy to help you learn!
Furthermore, it would be great if you had any experience with GCP or any Cloud platform at all. In our transformation journey cloud is top on the agenda. Having previously worked in agile teams will make you adapt to the work situation better, same goes with familiarity of CI/CD and automatization.
We believe, as an employer, that diversity is key to development in the workplace, and we welcome every type of person applying to our positions.


What we offerWe offer you the opportunity to build up an expertise that goes within the whole bank, where the advantages of working at SEB is getting to try and use modern technologies and be able to be more independent in certain tasksOpportunity of a career path both as a generalist and specialistGreat work-life balance, benefit package and hybrid work opportunityExtensive training and learning opportunities through our own digital university SEB Campus. We also offer mentorship programs, voluntary work, work shadowing and gigs where employees receive the opportunity to work in another part of the bank for a brief period
Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in or where they come from.
Ready to join?
Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today. If you have questions about the position, please contact Katarina Pihl, Talent Acquisition Partner at katarina.pihl@seb.se.
SEB is one of the largest Tech employers in the Nordics. We are international, business savvy techies that contribute to or are responsible for SEB’s banking software, ensuring that both internal and external products and services are delivered fast and efficiently, that access is always on, and that solutions are trusted and compliant. We work hard to future-proof SEB with world class digital architecture and the deployment of new technologies.
Read more: https://sebgroup.com/

post_title: Senior Data Engineer, Financial Data Products
description:
Engineering
Data
The Finance organization helps prepare Spotify for its continued future growth, both organically and through acquisitions. We believe in thinking about data as a product: We’re looking for data engineers willing to embrace end-to-end responsibilities, from solidifying technical foundations to using analytics to understand our consumers’ use cases and enabling them to answer key financial questions.
Location
Stockholm or Remote EMEA
Job type
Permanent
As a senior data engineer in the Overtone squad, you will support Finance’s efforts through the curation, production, and management of core financial data products. These high-quality datasets represent revenue and costs derived from ads, content, subscriptions, and partnerships while enabling critical initiatives such as Forecasting, Financial Reporting, and Financial Planning.
What you'll do
Design, prototype, and build data pipelines processing billions of data points daily.
Advocate for and implement best practices around data quality and engineering.
Apply product thinking to data: manage the data product lifecycle from sourcing to documentation and exposition while always keeping consumers’ success and experience in mind.
Partner with engineers, data scientists, and business teams to create flexible and intuitive data products supporting Spotify globally.
Learn from and collaborate with cross-functional financial stakeholders and develop an appreciation for their domain- Leverage mentorship and constructive feedback to drive accountability and growth within the team.
Who you are
Have a degree in Computer Science or a similar field.
3+ years of professional software engineering and programming experience (SQL, Java, C++, Scala, Python).
3+ years of architecture and design (patterns, reliability, scalability, quality) of complex systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving ability with advanced written and verbal communication skills.
Advanced coding skills, experience in distributed systems, functional principles & performance optimization.
T-Shaped. Your primary area is data engineering but you are comfortable with second areas such as data presentation, backend engineering, or front-end development.
Professional experience working in an agile environment.
Comfortable with tackling very loosely defined problems, especially when working on a team that has autonomy in their day-to-day decisions.
Have performed an analysis of large datasets in a cloud-based environment, preferably with an understanding of Google’s Cloud Platform.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform is beneficial.
Experience in mentoring and leading junior engineers is a plus.
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Europe region in which we have a work location.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences.
Working hours? We operate within the Central European Time zone for collaboration.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.
