Pay Band C salary is £25,702 to £27,938 per annum and Pay Band D salary is £31,931 to £34,709 per annum
Full-time – 37 hours a week
A range of flexible working options may be available (including some hybrid/remote working which BGS is currently trialling)
Permanent appointment
About us
The British Geological Survey (BGS) is an applied geoscience research centre that is part of UK Research and Innovation (UKRI) and is affiliated to the Natural Environment Research Council (NERC). It is a world leading geological survey whose core mission is to inform government of science related to the subsurface and to undertake applied research to solve earth and environmental issues, both in the UK and globally. It is funded directly by UKRI, as well as through research grants and private sector contracts.
BGS has an annual budget of approximately £60 million and employs 650 people. It has two main sites: a head office in Keyworth near Nottingham, and the Lyell Centre, which is a joint collaboration with Heriot Watt University in Edinburgh. BGS works with more than 150 private sector organisations, has close links with 40 universities, and sponsors approximately 100 PhD students each year.
We are committed to promoting equality and diversity across our organisation in order to continuously improve our scientific and organisational effectiveness. As such, we aim to have a workforce with employees from all backgrounds with people who are passionate about earth science and who share our commitment to work for the good of the environment and the benefit of society.
We will actively seek to avoid discrimination on the grounds of age, disability, race, sex or sexual orientation, being trans or a member of the non-binary community, being married or in a civil partnership, being pregnant or on maternity leave or religion.
The British Geological Survey has achieved Bronze status for Athena SWAN – a scheme that recognises an organisation’s commitment and progress in developing a diverse and inclusive workforce; we are also committed to the Disability Confident framework and, as part of UKRI, are members of Inclusive Employers.
The BGS Digital function are looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic Data Scientist to join the data analytics and processing group. The successful candidate could be based in either Keyworth, Edinburgh or Wallingford. The post is full-time and offered as a permanent appointment.
About the role
This post focusses on the development and application of data science and statistical tools within multidisciplinary teams to tackle global environmental and sustainability challenges related to the geosciences. These challenges have a global scope and include the development of approaches to reduce emissions from energy production by decarbonisation, to adapt to environmental change and to build resilience to natural hazards.
You will contribute to a range of statistical and data science projects work alongside researchers addressing science challenges across BGS and also with external collaborators. The projects will include methodological research to build capacity, the analysis of specific earth science and environmental data sets in the context of wider studies and the development of workflows to automate these analyses. You will be encouraged to disseminate your work via peer-reviewed publications and open source software tools.
This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing team who are undertaking environmental science research utilising innovative data science and statistical techniques, developing open source software and contributing to open datasets. Current research expertise within the team includes machine learning, deep learning, geostatistics and time series analyses.
You will work across varied and often multi-disciplinary project teams and provide the expertise required to develop, apply and advise on the use of data science and statistical methods, and other mathematical and analysis techniques. You will present the results of your analyses to a range of stakeholders.
You will be expected to have a role in the development of data analysis capability more generally within the organisation, and in collaboration with other academic and industrial partners.
About you
This post is suitable for someone who has graduated with a PhD or Master’s degree with a relevant data science or statistics focus or has the equivalent research experience. You should be enthusiastic to apply your technical skills within varied projects addressing earth science and environmental questions.
You should have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written and be able to communicate statistical concepts to non-scientists. The post will involve multidisciplinary team working, therefore you must be able to work effectively with scientists in different disciplines.
As part of the community of data scientists and statisticians in BGS, you will be expected to share your knowledge and input to the development of new research ideas and projects.
The work will be mostly UK based but you may be required to work overseas for short periods of time. You will also occasionally need to be able to travel between the BGS offices in the UK.
Please also refer to the specific essential and desirable skills criteria for this post.
What we offer
A generous benefits package is also offered, including a very competitive pension scheme, 30 days annual leave plus bank holidays, and access to flexi-time.
We also offer the ‘Bike to Work’ scheme, free car parking, health and wellbeing support and sports/social clubs.
All staff have access to a platform of learning and development opportunities and where appropriate to the role, technical/specialist training.
BGS provides a range of flexible working options including flexible working patterns, compressed hours and home working so if you have a need for flexibility, please raise this in the recruitment process when your needs, balanced with the requirements of the role, will be fully considered.
Please note that any internal BGS staff applying for this post would, if successful, be appointed to new UKRI Terms and Conditions and pay.
How to apply
Applicants are required to provide a CV and a cover letter outlining their suitability for this role. We would stress the importance of this paperwork in our selection process.
A well thought through application addressing the advertised essential and desirable criteria for the post will be considered far more favourably than a generic covering letter and CV.
Applications are being handled by UK Shared Business Services. To apply, please click apply.
The closing date for receipt of applications is Monday 23rd May 2022. Interviews are expected to be held in early June 2022.

post_title: Data Scientist - 6 month Fixed Term Contract
description:
We work with employers and educators across the UK and around the world, to drive change that reaches far beyond their walls. And we mean long-lasting, sustainable change – the kind that improves life chances as well as organisational performance. Data sits at the heart of a huge amount of our work. It sharpens our insights, informs our campaigns and builds our capability. You’ll help us, and our clients, make even more of it. 
 
 We are looking for a Data Scientist to join us for a 6-month maternity cover. 
 
 An expert member of our team, you’ll share your knowledge far and wide. You’ll lead the development and use of data science techniques all across our agency – from operations and products to services and consultancy. You’ll explore things like machine learning, data architecture and forecasting to transform the performance of clients across all kinds of sectors. And you’ll coach colleagues to develop their understanding of the value and application of data science in their work. 
 
 This is a brilliant opportunity to take our powerful data-science offering to the next level. And you’re ready to take it. You’re a curious, creative and analytical thinker with strong coaching skills and a broad understanding of data science methodologies techniques and knowledge of anomaly detection, clustering, segmentation and classification. You’re comfortable analysing databases and managing both complex projects and marketing-related data sets. And you have a solid set of technical skills and knowledge covering everything from Python, R and Tableau to machine-learning algorithms, data analysis and project management. 
 
 As well as a fascinating challenge, we offer some lovely benefits including 30 days holiday, life insurance, training budgets and, of course, a fantastic culture. You’ll also get to do work that transforms life chances as well as organisations. So join us, and make your love of data count for more. 
 
 We believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant and more resilient company. We welcome people from all backgrounds, ethnicities, cultures, and experiences. SMRS is an equal opportunity employer. 
 
 Benefits 
 30 days annual leave 
 Life insurance 
 Enhanced maternity/paternity policies 
 Cycle to work scheme 
 Training budget 
 Volunteering days 
 Staff initiatives 
 Internal coaching 
 Agency gatherings

info_remote: Aggreko, LLC - 574 reviews - Glasgow - Hybrid remote
description:
We deliver specialist turnkey solutions for power and temperature control. As we enter a new and exciting period of energy transition, the introduction of renewable and green solutions adds further to our global capability and class leading services.
  

    We have an exciting role for someone with Digital Asset Support experience, 
   At Aggreko, we have a lot going on – a commitment to be net-zero, new owners, a new purpose, new priorities – driving lots of activity to improve what we do for our colleagues and our customers.
We need someone in the digital/design asset space to help us engage our colleagues and customers in everything we’re trying to do to power progress for our customers.


    We have an exciting opportunity for a Analyst – Data Scientist to join our established team in Glasgow. With flexible hybrid working this role will work within a team of experts in our analytics team, collaborating with our business partners to deliver insight. The team is innovative and agile and focuses on providing solutions that deliver value for the organisation, driving profitability and efficiency through the application of advanced analytics and data science. Analytics is at the heart of the organisation, and the data science team lead projects which enable insight-driven decision making.
  


    Key Responsibilities:
  

 Work with the data



 Develop and enhance datasets to support the development of analytical insight delivery, working with existing technologies and identifying new and relevant technologies
 Carry out data discovery to understand the strength and limitations of the data, uncover hidden patterns, and proactively identify hidden insights
 Develop predictive models using relevant data, which improve insight and support insight-driven decision making
 Create useable, scalable and repeatable processes which are flexible to support the evolving needs of the business, identifying continual areas of improvement



 Work with the team



 Work closely with business partners to understand key challenges, data, processes and products, to identify opportunities for analytics to drive value, and build data products that inform decision-making
 Effectively communicate with key stakeholders to present findings, and contribute to identifying new opportunities where analytics can drive value and performance across the business
 Provide technical expertise to the team, bringing new ideas from academia and industry to the wider organisation
 Deliver ad hoc analytical projects and / or research as required alongside other relevant tasks requested by the Data Science Lead


 Maintain best practice



 Document data and statistical models in a proportionate way to business requirements
 Maintain best-practice standards in coding, reporting and communication



    Professional skills / experience
  


 Technical capability



 Highly numerate, with excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
 Experience in creating and using statistical models, for example; cluster analysis, decision trees, regression, propensity modelling, Bayesian, NLP, machine learning, AI, and other
 Qualitative and quantitative analytical skills and proficiency within Python/SQL/R /Java/Hive, or similar


 Collaboration and communication


 Excellent team player with the ability to effectively collaborate with the team and the business
 A track record of working on own initiative and demonstrating proactivity, with the ability to introduce fresh thinking to the role and the wider team



    At Aggreko we power progress by delivering energy anywhere
    We deliver energy solutions in over 80 countries, helping customers on their energy transition journey, working together towards a sustainable future.
    If our mission excites you, you’re in the right place; we want you to bring your own energy to help us create a better world.
    At Aggreko, no two days are the same. We work in dynamic environments and offer a wide range of opportunities for motivated people to enrich their lives and communities. If you're prepared to give us your best, you can learn and grow quickly.
    We're building an inclusive culture and an environment where everyone can be at their best. We encourage everyone to be themselves at work because we know that’s how we achieve our potential.
  


    Join us and let Aggreko help you power your career.
  


    About Us
  

 We are the people who use our big boxes to make a massive difference. We believe in the positive impact of power and the ability to control temperature. We believe what we do opens up opportunity and creates potential for individuals, communities, industries and societies over the world. We believe when we work together we can do anything. We believe in the power of our team. We are the people who keep the lights on. And we recruit the best talent, too.
   
 Our four values help us get even better at what we do. It’s the Aggreko way of working – we call it Always Orange.
  


    Always Orange means:
   
 Being dynamic: We’re nimble and are always ready to react to an ever changing world.
    Being expert: We know our stuff, we’re great under pressure and we thrive in our busy, fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. We use our experience to make a difference. We know how to challenge and we have the courage of our convictions.
    Being together: We play for Team Aggreko and value the expertise of everyone around us. We’re accountable and we hold others to account.
    Being innovative: We never miss an opportunity to learn, to look out, or to be better.
  


    Aggreko is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive environment that allows each employee to be their best based upon their merit, talent and aspiration. We do not discriminate, and we abide by the laws in the locations in which we operate.

Permanent
    



     40 Hours 
    


Salary

     Excellent
    


Country

     U.K 
    


What you will be doing...

Reporting to the General Manager - Data Science the Senior Data Scientist will be a key part of the Data Science Team, executing the data science strategy and bringing together multiple large data sources for effective use across the business. This is a hybrid role, with the ability and scope to work flexibly between our city centre offices and home. You will have strong experience in leading data science projects & creating machine learning models.  In this exciting new role you will be expected to collaborate with internal teams across the business and identify, and collaborate with stakeholders across the wider group. You will use machine learning and statistical modelling tools to generate customer, marketing and commercial Insight, which in turn will inform marketing strategy, pricing and product development for the business. You will identify efficiencies in the use of data across its lifecycle, reducing data redundancy, structuring data to ensure efficient use of time and ensuring retained data/information provides value to the organisation and remains in-line with legitimate business and/or regulatory requirements. You will create algorithms and models to understand how changes in metrics in one area of the business impact other areas, always working with multiple teams across the business to deliver the data science roadmap.  The successful candidate will be highly numerate with a statistical background, experienced in using R, Python or similar statistical analysis package. Strong SQL skills and the ability to create clear data visualisations in tools such as Tableau or Power BI will be essential, and also having developed and deployed predictive models using machine learning frameworks and worked with big data technologies. You will be skilled in gathering data from multiple sources and in multiple formats with knowledge of data warehouse design, logical and physical database design and challenges posed by data quality. Demonstrable experience in cleansing and enriching of data, interpret business requirements in terms of data architecture, database technology and data model design will also be key. You will be able to demonstrate your experience in leading junior data scientists, and have hands on experience of project delivery.  What can we offer you?  We have been recognised as one of the Top 50 Best Places to Work in the UK on Glassdoor and offer our valued colleagues a range of benefits including: -

 Competitive salary
 Contributory pension scheme
 26 days holiday entitlement per annum (plus bank holidays)
 3 x salary life assurance
 Generous Discretionary Profit Share Scheme
 Colleague discounts on Jet2holidays and Jet2.com holidays and flights
 Share Save scheme
 Cycle to Work Scheme
 Access to Mental Health First Aiders
 Annual pay review
 Many retail discounts on – travel and leisure, health, and wellbeing, eating out, shopping and lifestyle

 We offer an excellent remuneration package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.  This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting, forward-thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 10 UK bases.  Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!



Division

     Jet2.com
    


Careers With Us

     Digital & IT 
    


Careers Dept

     Marketing
    


Careers Team

     Data Science 
    


Business Area

     Head Office and Support Functions 
    


Team

     Marketing

Stuart (DPD Group) is a sustainable last-mile logistics company that connects retailers and e-merchants to a fleet of geolocalised couriers across several countries in Europe.
   


 Our Mission
   

     We are an impact-driven company that aims to build the future of logistics for a more sustainable world: shared, efficient and reliable. We are committed to creating a new standard for urban deliveries that meet today’s environmental and social challenges while offering a premium delivery experience blending speed, flexibility and convenience.
    




    Our motto: “Make every delivery a moment all of us can truly celebrate!” More than 3000+ leading brands already partner with us across Restaurants, Grocery, Retail & Luxury, eCommerce and Professional Services to deliver all types of goods at the tap of a button. Stuart is a highly diverse and inclusive company of 700+ employees with 90+ nationalities working across France , Italy , Poland , Portugal , Spain and the U.K.
   


 It’s the right moment and the right place for us to make an impact on millions of people, as home delivery services hit a record high. And guess what? You can help us fulfil our vision
   


 About the Data Science Team



 You will join our Data Science team to develop algorithm-driven solutions for all business- and operations-related challenges at Stuart in order to scale our operations in Europe. Your focus will be to participate in the research on new algorithms and methods to address topics that are both pain and gain for Stuart’s Business and Operations’ teams such as:
   


 Demand & supply forecast: how many packages need to be delivered at any time and zone? and how many drivers are available at that time and zone?
Incentive optimization: how can we move the driver to high-demand zones while staying profitable?
Real-time fraud detection & prevention: how can we detect drivers rigging the system & call them out while doing so?
Ride acceptance prediction: how likely is it that a driver is in for the ride?
Driver lifetime value: how long and regularly will a driver work for us?
Client churn: do our clients still love us?
And plenty more ...



 We seek to develop and deliver machine learning services to enable making better business decisions and to provide operational smoothness. Our work is always a team effort where we analyze the conditions and boundaries together with business and operations’ stakeholders and implement high-performance & robust products together with our Platform & Data engineering teams. Our ultimate goal is to understand the business, determine the limits of state-of-the-art solutions, and break them!
   


 We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our gathering of 12 Physicists, Mathematicians, and Engineers who compose our Data Science team, striving to provide the most efficient and highest performing algorithms in the delivery industry.
   


 If you are passionate about high-performance algorithms for complex problems, big data technologies, or mathematical modeling of business problems, we can guarantee you're in for a ride.
   





 What will I be doing?

 Participating in scientific discussions about our algorithms and provide original insights. Developing data-centric services such as live short-term and static long-term forecasts, fraud detection, prediction of driver behaviors, personalized heatmaps, etc … Formulating hypotheses about the problem at hand. Designing experiments and A/B tests to verify our hypotheses and analyze the data to support them. Building a proof-of-concept machine-learning model and test it on actual business cases. Integrating the model into a production pipeline alongside platform & data engineers. Establishing a performance monitoring protocol for the production model/service. Playing and explore with data and technology to come up with groundbreaking ideas that our product team would have not dreamt of in their wildest dreams.





What do we need from you?

 2+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or any similar role (a least one year in non-academic positions). Solid background in probability / statistics. Ph.D. or MSc in quantitative Sciences (Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Biology). Proven experience in Machine Learning using Python, R, or Scala.





Nice to have ✨

 SQL and some NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB. Virtualization using Docker. Workflow management platforms (Airflow, etc.) Event-driven architecture (Kafka Streams, Spark Streaming, Flink, etc…) Distributed computing (Spark, Hadoop, etc…)





The stuff you wanna know

 Family-friendly work-life balance - work from home and flexible hours Wellness Allowance (£40 monthly) to use in any gym or sport class £200 per month for food (groceries / restaurants / food apps etc) Audible subscription Unlimited access to Udemy for all your learning and development needs Stuart Academy with regular workshops, Stu-Classes, and Stu-Talks Stuart is putting Mental Health Awareness first! Wellness Allowance (£40 monthly) to use in any gym or sport class Private healthcare provided by AXA ‍ ️ Pension taken care of through a partnership with Royal London. Five months paid maternity leave. Work in an international, dynamic and passionate environment with a company culture focused on learning and development





    You’ve read all this way but you’re missing a skill or two? No problem, it’s our job to up-skill you to take your career to the next level. What we’re trying to say is, don’t be afraid to apply if you don’t tick all the boxes
   


 At Stuart, we believe that employees today want to evolve in collaborative, high-growth environments where they can demonstrate their abilities and thrive both professionally and personally. We are convinced that employees need to find alignment between their inner values and their company’s culture and mission to unlock their full potential. We work to create a culture of empowerment, continuous learning and growth where everyone can bring expertise, own projects and easily measure their impact
   


 Stuart is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status
   


 Please note: Our Talent Acquisition Team is international coming from across the world We kindly ask you to please submit your CV and application in English so that it can be reviewed correctly (unless the job posting is in a language other than English). Thank you



 Want to learn more about us? Visit https://stuart.com/about-us/

description:
Details

Reference number

      195761 
     


Salary

       £31,989 - £55,666
     


Grade


        Higher Executive Officer
        Senior Executive Officer
      



 Contract type

       Permanent
     


 Business area

       DWP - Digital
     


 Type of role

       Digital
     


 Working pattern

       Flexible working, Full-time, Job share, Part-time
     


 Number of posts

       2
     





 


 Location



       These roles can be based in Leeds or Sheffield. Please find further information on the Corporate hub locations here.
     


 About the job


 Summary

       Would you love the opportunity to examine our wealth of data and use this to improve the customer journey? 
      
 Are you someone who is skilled at using a variety of data handing tools to harness the power of data? 
      
 If so click that apply button now and join us a Data Scientist. 
      
 DWP Digital offers uniquely inspiring and fulfilling career opportunities for people passionate about making a genuine difference to society. 
      
 We are undergoing a major digital transformation programme and data science is recognised as having a critical role to play; not only in the better design of our services, but also making them more personalized for each individual’s circumstances and making big shifts in our effectiveness and efficiency. 
      
 We're looking for an Associate Data Scientists and a Data Scientist. In these roles you will be actively involved in the technical development of analytical products. You will work as part of a diverse multi-disciplinary team to deliver data science solutions, and act as a proactive link between operational, technical and analytical teams. You will deliver proactive, innovative and insightful data products via agile philosophies and cloud technologies that tangibly improves the outcomes for millions of citizens across the country. 
      
 You will also be motivated to discover patterns in data and embed that insight in products that enable innovative ways to support service transformation, optimize service delivery and increase customer experience using techniques such as process mining, optimization, machine learning, and prediction.
     


 Job description

       A Data Scientist role involves owning projects and applying specialist programming skills with data analytics techniques in order to find and share patterns in data that can be put into action and drive better decisions across the business. 
      
 In Operational Analytics we look at data analysis to improve efficiency and streamline everyday operations, supporting improvements in customer experience, staff productivity and service optimisation. 
      
 You will own or work collaboratively on data science ‘projects’ which include identifying a specific business need, data gathering, requirements specification, determining the best tools, data and techniques to address it, execute analysis, ongoing deliverables, recommendations and presentations. 
      
 The candidate will work with a wide range of data originating from the Operational systems, via cloud, utilising your skills in SQl/R/Python. 
      


Work on multiple data science projects and influence the business case for delivery to proactively address specific business needs, using the most appropriate techniques, data sources and technologies. 



Collaborate on defining analytics development best practices, commitment to quality assurance of predictive models and demonstrate ethical considerations such as unintended biases. 



Build relationships with a wide group of business and technical stakeholders, seeking and learning from feedback to drive continuous improvement. 



Communicate data-driven insights set within a business context clearly and with impact to a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders, choosing appropriate styles to ensure understanding and influencing outcomes. 

 Check out these blogs about careers in Data with DWP Digital.
     


 Responsibilities

       The responsibilities are outlined in the job description above. 
      
 This job role may be suitable for hybrid working, which is where an employee works part of the week in their DWP office and part of the week from home. This is a voluntary, non-contractual arrangement and your office will be your contractual place of work. The number of days that anyone will be able to work at home will be determined primarily by business need but personal circumstances and other relevant circumstances will also be taken into account. If you are successful, any opportunities for hybrid working, including whether a hybrid working arrangement is suitable for you, will be discussed with you prior to you taking up your post.
     


 Behaviours

We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:

Delivering at Pace
Changing and Improving
Communicating and Influencing




Technical skills

We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:

Communicating Analysis and Insight
Programming and Build




Benefits



Learning and development tailored to your role. 
An environment with flexible working options. 
A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity. 
An employer pension contribution of up to 27%. 
A generous annual leave allowance. 


Salary Information

 HEO 
      Salary for this role is from £31,989 (Band min) to £34,285 (Band max). 
      Where the maximum salary is offered, a Digital Allowance of up to £9,736 per annum is available for exceptional candidates. 
     
 SEO 
      Salary for this role is from £35,310 (Band min) to £40,666 (Band max). 
      Where the maximum salary of is offered, a Digital Allowance of up to £15,000 per annum is available for exceptional candidates. 
     
 Our offer to successful candidates will be based on an assessment of your skills and experience as demonstrated at interview. 
     
 Existing Civil Servants who secure a new role on lateral transfer should maintain their current salary. 
     
 Existing Civil Servants who gain promotion may move to the bottom of the next grade pay scale or 10% increase in salary whichever would be the greater.
    

 Things you need to know


 Security


        Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
      



        Successful candidates must meet the security requirements before they can be appointed. The level of security needed is security check.
       
 See our vetting charter.
      



        People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
      



 Selection process details


        This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Experience and Technical skills.
      



 Stage 1: Application

 Your application will consist of three parts: 
       
 1. A Personal Details application form. 
       
 2. Your employment history detailing your responsibilities, skills, accomplishments, plus your qualifications and relevant training. Please copy this information into the box field provided. 
       
 3. Personal statement 750 words. 
       
 When giving details in your CV and personal statement you should highlight your experience in line with essential criteria below: 
       


Communicating analysis & insight: Aware of the need to translate technical concepts into non-technical language and understands what communication is required to internal and external stakeholders. 



Programming & build: Understands the process of software development and has a basic knowledge of how services/software components are developed and built. 



Experience of using R/Python/SQL 



Experience of working with others to identify areas for improvement and simplify processes to use fewer resources. 



Experience of regularly monitoring your own work against milestones ensuring delivery at pace. Act promptly to reassess own workload and priorities when there are conflicting demands to maintain performance. 

 The sift panel will use the information in your employment history and personal statement to assess your experience, skills and knowledge against the essential criteria above. 
       
 For Hints and Tips on completing your application visit our blog Getting Hired at DWP Digital . 
       

Important Information



You will be asked to complete your employment history any information that you would customarily share on a CV should therefore be entered onto the application form. 
Personal details that could be used to identify you including your name, contact details and address must be removed for your application to be considered. 
If your employment history/personal statement contains any personal details your application will be withdrawn. 


Stage 2: Interview

 If you’re successful at sift stage you will be invited to a video interview via Microsoft Teams. There, you will be assessed against the following Behaviours, Technical Skills and Experiences: 
       


Delivery at Pace 



Changing and improving 



Communicating and Influencing 



Communicating Analysis and Insight 
Turns complex data into compelling, clear and actionable stories. Shares data communication skills with the team and across government. Presents analysis and visualisations in clear ways to communicate complex messages. Is able to communicate negative and positive information to stakeholders. Able to give tactical and strategic recommendations. 
       


Programming and Build 
Collaborates with others when necessary to review specifications and uses these agreed standards and tools to design, code, test, correct and document programmes or scripts of medium to high complexity, using the right standards and tools 
       


Experience of presenting, communicating and disseminating analysis and recommendations effectively, appropriately and with high impact to a range of audiences. 

 You will be asked to do a short (5 -10 minutes) presentation on a specific topic. Further details will be provided to candidates invited to interview. 
       

Other information:

 A reserve list may be held for a period of 6 months from which further appointments can be made. 
       
 You must meet the security requirements before you can be appointed. The level of security needed is security check. 
       
 For meaningful checks to be carried out individuals you will need to have lived in the UK for a sufficient period of time, to enable appropriate checks to be carried out and produce a result which provides the required level of assurance. Whilst a lack of UK residency in itself is not necessarily a bar to a security clearance, and expectation of UK residency may range from 3 to 5 years. Failure to meet the residency requirements needed for the role may result in the withdrawal of provisional jobs offers.
       
 Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
      



 Nationality requirements


This job is broadly open to the following groups:

UK nationals
nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
nationals of the Republic of Ireland
nationals from the EU, EEA or Switzerland with settled or pre-settled status or who apply for either status by the deadline of the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals working in the Civil Service
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals who have built up the right to work in the Civil Service
certain family members of the relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals
Further information on nationality requirements 
      



Working for the Civil Service


        The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.
       
 We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
      



        The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.
      



 Apply and further information



       This vacancy is part of the Great Place to Work for Veterans initiative.
     



       Once this job has closed, the job advert will no longer be available. You may want to save a copy for your records.
     


 Contact point for applicants

 Job contact : 

Name : 
        
         Peter Sweeney
        
 Email : 
        
         Peter.Sweeney1@dwp.gov.uk
        

 Recruitment team : 

Email : 
        
         digitalrecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk
        




 Further information


        Appointment to the Civil Service is governed by the Civil Service Commission’s Recruitment Principles. If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with these principles and you wish to make a complaint, you should in the first instance contact DWP by email: HR.BUSINESSASSURANCE@DWP.GOV.UK. If you are not satisfied with the response you receive from the Department, you can contact the Civil Service Commission here to visit Civil Service Commission.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Scientist (Aberdeen or Remote based) 

Job Overview  The successful candidate will have experience deploying the latest Data Science analytic technologies, Machine learning and AI to solve practical and commercial/industrial challenges. They will be capable of supervising, developing and mentoring Data Analysts and Scientists. A key element of the role will involve the development and use of a range of analytics tools to perform analysis of large quantities of data, identifying anomalies, trends, and areas of further investigation. This role also provides specific inputs to the product development program of X-PAS™ Operational Stability and Emissions Reduction and will be involved in coaching super users and users of the platform. In addition, they will be constantly looking to design and implement process, procedure and technology enhancements using the latest technologies and AI that efficiency savings in our existing operational processes and offer added value to our customers.  The candidate should:  Have 5-10 years’ experience in applied Data Science  Be qualified to at least BSc level in Data Science / Applied Analytics or similar; PhD or other further qualification advantageous, but only if combined with proven practical track record  Possess knowledge and experience of statistical modelling techniques, development of novel analytical approaches and use of mathematical / machine learning algorithms  Have a proven ability in big data analysis, be able to identify anomalies and trends, and create and apply predictive models using a range of methodologies and approaches  Have experience in working within a multi-discipline team

     Data Science 
    


Business Area

     Head Office and Support Functions 
    


Team

     Marketing

About NCR
  

    NCR Corporation (NYSE: NCR) is a leading software- and services-led enterprise provider in the financial, retail and hospitality industries. NCR is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with 36,000 employees globally. NCR is a trademark of NCR Corporation in the United States and other countries.
  


 NCR Consulting is a new breed of partnership designed to empower clients to leverage tangible strategy for sustainable growth. The market landscape has dramatically changed: consumers want the same kind of experience with every brand they encounter; there is a powerful convergence of marketing and technology; and brands are no longer built through advertising, but through experiences.
   
 Organizations need a partner that is part business consultancy and part technology powerhouse to enable them to design, build and run differentiated experiences to unlock exponential growth.
  

    Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist
  

    The role:
  

    As a Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist you will design and build data science solutions for clients in various industries and contribute to a growing team of data scientists, data engineers and product managers to deliver an ambitious and innovative product roadmap. This includes:
  

 Work across retail, hospitality, and financial services sectors to assess client demands and contribute to data and AI solutions that provide practical, value-added insight for clients
 Formulate hypotheses and present findings, key insights and proposed solutions to client teams
 Design and implement innovative analytical solutions to a wide spectrum of problems such as product demand forecasting, customer acquisition and retention, customer segmentation, customer lifetime value, sentiment analysis of product and brand, profitability and pricing optimization, fraud detection, among others.
 Manipulate and analyze large-scale datasets from a wide variety of structured and unstructured databases, 3rd party providers and publicly available data
 Develop, prototype and test machine learning algorithms, including regression models, decision trees, random forests, gradient boosting, deep learning, clustering and NLP/topic models
 Leverage cloud computing infrastructures, big data platforms and relational database environments


    Technical Qualifications:
  

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Data Science or related field. Masters or PhD degree is a plus.
 Experience using Python or R to manipulate data and implement data science solutions.
 Experience working with large-scale databases (SQL or NoSQL) and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)
 Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
 Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (e.g. regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests) and experience with applications
 Experience with tools in the distributed computing, cloud platforms and Big Data domains is a plus (e.g. HPC, GCP, AWS, MS Azure, Hadoop, Spark)


    Personal Qualifications:
  

 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to quickly process complex information and present it clearly and simply
 Strong written and verbal communication skills
 Good critical thinking skills and the ability to combine and apply tools/solutions to ambiguous problems
 Passionate about learning and mastering new technologies and techniques, and equally sharing best practices with team members
 Flexible and adaptive, able to work across multiple projects


    Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the job.
  


    EEO Statement
    Integrated into our shared values is NCR's commitment to diversity and equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, military service, genetic information, or any other characteristic or conduct protected by law. NCR is committed to being a globally inclusive company where all people are treated fairly, recognized for their individuality, promoted based on performance and encouraged to strive to reach their full potential. We believe in understanding and respecting differences among all people. Every individual at NCR has an ongoing responsibility to respect and support a globally diverse environment.
  

 Statement to Third Party Agencies
    To ALL recruitment agencies: NCR only accepts resumes from agencies on the NCR preferred supplier list. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, NCR employees, or any NCR facility. NCR is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

description:
Data Scientist
The offer 
· 12-month contract 
· Remote 
· Weekly pay 
· £115,000 - £150,000 per annum 
The main function of the Data Scientist is to produce innovative solutions driven by exploratory data analysis from complex and high-dimensional datasets.
We are looking for a Data scientist with experience working with A/B testing frameworks for Online Experimentation.
Job Responsibilities: 

Apply knowledge of statistics, hypothesis testing frameworks, SQL, Python/R, programming, data modelling, simulation, and advanced mathematics to recognize patterns, identify opportunities, pose business questions, and make valuable discoveries leading to prototype development and product improvement.
Generate and test hypotheses and analyse and interpret the results of product experiments.
Work with software engineers to translate prototypes into new products, services, and features and provide guidelines for large-scale experimentation.

Skills: 

Masters or Phd In statistics/Computer Science/Mathematics or other quantitative field
Experience working with online experimentation in tech (A/B testing frameworks)
Proficiency with SQL and R/Python languages
The ability to communicate effectively in writing and speaking, for both technical and business audiences
Experience working with large datasets and pipelines

Education/Experience: 

Masters or Phd In statistics/Computer Science/Mathematics or other quantitative field
At least 5 years of work experience in the industry

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary contract, Temp to permContract length: 12 months
Salary: £115,000.00-£145,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Work from home

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Remote: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

Master's (preferred)

Experience:

Data Scientist: 4 years (required)

Reference ID: 29028Expected start date: 05/05/2022

Location: Twinkl HQ, Sheffield (remote working optional)
 Annual Salary: £25,000 - £29,000 Contract: Permanent  Line Manager: George Mulroy  Recruiter: Rikki Spencer-Cox
As a new member of the Twinkl data team you’ll be joining our established analytics network of 15+ data scientists and data analysts during an exciting period of growth (10 additional hires planned!). Working closely with the Head of Data and other experienced data scientists, you will be at the forefront of how analytics is used at Twinkl; tasked with ensuring that we derive the maximum value possible from our rich and varied datasets (over 10 trillion data points at the last count!).
Dependant on your interests and experience, you will work in one or more of the following data scientist teams: 

The Key Algorithms team: ensuring that every one of our key customer-facing algorithms (recommendations, internal search, etc) is providing the best possible website experience for every one of our customers.
The Key Subscription Metrics team: making sure that our product helps as many customers as possible by maximising subscription uptake measures such as activation, retention, upgrade and winback rate.
The Data Reporting Team: finding new ways to take data reporting to the next level and facilitate the entire business to make data-driven decisions.
The Projects team: prioritising high value data-driven projects on an ad-hoc basis to ensure that our data assets are continuously being leveraged to add the highest level of value to the organisation.

In the data team how you achieve your task is 100% over to you: no one is going to be prescribing exactly what to do, or exactly how to do it (although you’ll have a strong network of experienced Data Scientists to help you out!). To be successful you’ll need to innovate, chat with key stakeholders, and read up on best practices in order to identify and implement the most appropriate data-led solution (see ‘ongoing projects’ below to see the exciting projects the current team are working on!)
You will find the data team regularly using SQL, Python, GA, Elasticsearch and BigQuery; as well as Jira and GSheets for project management. Depending on the challenge at hand, we also use Tableau for in-depth visualisations, and big data technologies to implement machine learning solutions that Python can’t handle. Don’t worry if you’ve not used all these techs before - we’re not necessarily looking for someone with lots of experience with these languages specifically, it’s an insatiable curiosity and innate ability to think logically that we’re most interested in.
 Ongoing projects:

Leveraging our recommendation systems to preempt customer need and email them the teaching resources they need for the coming week, before they know they need them.
Continuous collaboration with the conversion rate optimisation team to test and improve all touchpoints of the user experience in a data led progression.
Blending traditional search engine logic (think TF-IDF) with cutting edge machine techniques in order to provide the best possible search experience.
Using a hybrid collaborative-filtering approach to show the most relevant resource page recommendations on each of our 500 000 resource pages.
Engineering data pipelines that analyse customer need in real-time to automatically flag (and address!) gaps in our product offering as soon as they arise.
Visit our Data Science Blog to find out more 

To succeed in the role, you will:

Have a strong analytical mindset and relentless attention to detail.
Have the ability to see projects through from conception to delivery, bringing actionable insight to bear.
Have the ability to break down complex problems into manageable parts that can be actioned step by step.
Have excellent communication skills, including being able to explain complicated concepts in layman’s terms.
Be able to identify viable business opportunities that can be actioned using data.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

 Compose complex queries; pulling the information you need from our huge data sets (the biggest of which has more than a trillion data points!)
Implement machine learning techniques using a flexible variety of tooling and programming languages.
Work closely with senior leaders, experienced data scientists and a range of others across all levels of the organisation; partnering with them to deliver concrete results on a data led project. 
Attend in-house bi weekly training sessions, covering a range of key technical and soft skills
Apply for one of our fully funded spaces on the part-time Developer Academy Data Science course (usually costs £5000)

You’ll work with:

George Mulroy (Head of Data) - George started his career as an infant school teacher before retraining as a Data Scientist (Sheffield Uni Data Science MSc). George now works as Twinkl’s Head of Data, as well as doing occasional contract Data Science Consultancy work. 
Thomas Gibbs - leading our Key Algorithms team
Leopold Price - leading our Projects team
Ryan Borthwick - leading our Data Reporting team

Requirements
 We're interested in anyone who meets the following criteria:

Is excited and passionate about Twinkl’s mission
Holds a degree (or equivalent) in a quantitative field OR 1+ years employed in a role with a clear analytical focus. 
Has experience in, or can demonstrate a keen interest in learning SQL & Python
Can demonstrate a genuine interest and passion for working in Data Science

Think you smash those criteria and then some? Then please feel free to check out our Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist roles :)
Twinkl are proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer. We celebrate diversity within all of our teams and are committed to continuing to build an inclusive workplace for all. If you require a reasonable adjustment to the application/selection process to enable you to demonstrate your ability to perform the job requirements please include this at the foot of your covering letter. This will help us to understand any modifications we may need to make to support you throughout our selection process.
 Benefits
 In return for everything you can bring, we can offer you an exciting role in a fast-growing and dynamic business, with plenty of career opportunities.
 Here’s a couple of the things that make Twinkl a great place to be:

A friendly, welcoming and supportive culture. We believe work should be fun and always put people before process
Diversity, inclusion and belonging - our Employee Network Program includes working groups for LGBTQ+, People of Colour, Disabilities (visible and invisible), Women in Tech and Working Parents.
From day 1 - Westfield Health, 29 annual leave days per year plus up to four additional days that may be awarded each year by the company, flexible working policy with opportunities to work from home, Twinkl subscription, access to a financial wellbeing coach and platform
After probation - company sick pay and cycle to work scheme
Long term service reward after 2+ years of service - Life insurance, enhanced pension contribution, enhanced maternity pay, enhanced adoption pay and enhanced paternity pay.

Holds a degree (or equivalent) in a quantitative field (e.g. Maths, Computer Science, etc)

Commercial experience of programming in SQL/Python, and implementing machine learning solutions
[bonus] Experience in, and/or a keen interest in leading a small team

Not sure you fit all those criteria? Then please feel free to check out our Graduate Data Scientist and Data Scientist roles :)

info_remote: Hitachi Energy - 15 reviews - Zaragoza, Zaragoza provincia
description:
At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation
Hitachi Energy is seeking a Data Scientist for its Digital Solutions group in USA, this position will be located in our Technology Center in Zaragoza (Spain). This position is a data scientist role in a R&D team which is serving global technology development of distribution transformer business. Our business is power equipment manufacturing which involves various business processes from engineering to manufacturing. Candidates will be required to travel up to 15% (globally) based on project needs.
Your responsibilities

Display technical expertise in data analytics to a team of diversified technical competencies. 
Propose project initiatives and value-added analytics that will drive business productivity
Display a proficiency in the application of machine learning in engineering design process, use of predictive modeling in engineering and manufacturing process, creation and maintenance of data warehouse, business intelligence initiatives and asset diagnostic algorithms
Use data visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau to create professional quality dashboards and reports
Develop predictive models and utilize machine learning/data science techniques such as Hierarchical Clustering, Artificial Neural Networks, Ensemble Learning, Random Forest, Naive Bayes, etc.
Consolidate SQL database from multiple sources, data cleaning and manipulation in preparation for analytics and machine learning

Your background

BS in Computer Science, Data Science or related discipline
At least 5 years of related working experience in data science, data analytics, machine learning and business intelligence
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Experience with Python (Scikit-learn, XGBoost, Tensorflow, Pytorch, Numpy, Pandas)
Experience in utilizing cloud-based environment for developing and deploying machine learning solutions such as Azure Machine Learning Studio
Experience with MLOPS including model monitoring, registration, deployment. 
Experience using and building Azure DEVOPS pipeline
Experience with Azure data platform (Synapse, Azure data factory, Azure Data Lake Storage)
Experience with power product (transformer) or industrial goods manufacturing environment 
Proven record to learn new business background, engineering and manufacturing process quickly
Familiar with modern SDLC and project management process/tools
Innovative and creative self-starter who is enthusiastic to challenge status-quo
Ability to quickly grasp concepts from a field that is not one's core competency; a fast-learning generalist capable of solving problem independently and resourceful in matrixed corporate environment
Current work permit valid in Spain.

More about us
Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 38,000 people in 90 countries and generate business volumes of approximately $10 billion USD. www.hitachienergy.com

info_remote: Hays - 1,009 reviews - Barcelona, Barcelona provincia - Remote
description:
Tu nuevo puesto

 Integrado en el servicio de riesgo cliente y modelos de score, la persona incorporada desarrollará modelos matemáticos/estadísticos con el objetivo de predecir el comportamiento futuro de los potenciales clientes, así como el de los clientes actuales para dotar a la empresa de sistemas que permitan optimizar la creación de negocio y el seguimiento del mismo.
  
 Además colaborará en proyectos relacionados con modelos matemáticos/estadísticos, así como en ensayos analíticos que permitan detectar mejoras en la gestión del riesgo.
  
 Realizará la documentación asociada a los procesos que lleve a cabo (creación
   de modelos, etc).
  
 Trabajará con las herramientas estadísticas existentes para el control y seguimiento del riesgo.
  


Qué necesitarás para encajar con el puesto



Formación requerida: Graduado en estadística, matemáticas, física o similares, sustituibles por estudios 
superiores en ámbito empresarial (ADE, Economía o similar) siempre que esté asociado a experiencia en la creación de modelos.
  

Conocimiento avanzado de lenguaje de programación SAS.
Valorable máster data science, conocimientos en Phyton y R.
Experiencia: Mínimo 3 años de experiencia realizando análisis estadístico, minería de datos y elaboración y mantenimiento de modelos de score, preferiblemente en finanzas o banca.


 

Qué obtendrás a cambio

 Variable empresa
  

Plus transporte y digital
Cheques Restaurante
Teletrabajo 40% mensual


 

Tu siguiente paso

 Si estás interesado en esta oferta, haz click en 'aplicar ahora' para enviar una copia actualizada de tu CV, o llámanos ahora.
   Si esta oferta no se adapta a tu perfil pero estás buscando un nuevo puesto de trabajo, por favor contáctanos y lo comentamos. Te garantizamos la confidencialidad.

Descripción
 Desde ServiguideTech nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Data Scientist con al menos 2 años de experiencia para trabajar en un importante proyecto del sector banca. 


Funciones a groso modo:
 Análisis de datos. 


Modalidad: Hibrido 2 días en oficina 3 remoto. 
Horario: Lunes a JuVES DE 8:00 A 18:00 Viernes DE 8:00 A 15:00.
 Contrato: indefinido - proyecto estable.
 Beneficios fiscales: seguro médico, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería, ticket transporte, formación.
 Salario: a evaluar según perfil y experiencia aportada.
 Incorporación: Inmediata/ 15 días.

 Requisitos
 Requisitos Impresindibles:

 Al menos 2 años de experiencia
ML / ANÁLISIS DE DATOS
Estadística básica: media, moda, mediana, varianza, probabilidad, probabilidad condicionada. 



*Análisis exploratorio de datos, limpieza de datos, tratamiento de outliers. *


 Modelos no supervisados (e.g., PCA, Autoencoders, clustering,...) y supervisados (e.g., Random Forest, GBM, Regresión Logística,...). 




Técnicas de evaluación de modelos: matrices de confusión, ROC, clases desbalanceadas. Calibración de un modelo. 




Métodos para testear hipótesis (contrastes de hipótesis, A/B testing). 



DESARROLLO / TÉCNICAS:

Experiencia en ML con python y (py)spark. 
Operaciones con bases de datos: creación de consultas y procesos de extracción / modelado de información. 
Uso de repositorios de código y buenas prácticas de desarrollo (test unitarios, PRs,...).


 Conocimientos Deseables:

Conocimiento sobre grafos (algunas métricas o algoritmos sobre grafos), NLP, NN.
Conocimiento de TensorFlow.


 Softskills:

Experiencia en entornos agile 
Buena comunicación


 2 years

Envie de participer à la transition énergétique en poursuivant notre objectif de faire d’ ENGIE le leader du confort vert en France ? Si tu souhaites vivre une expérience enrichissante à valeur ajoutée, ne pas te cantonner à la machine à café et la photocopieuse alors postules sur cette offre et rejoins nos équipes à la Business Unit France BtoC ! 

La Business Unit France BtoC du Groupe ENGIE , propose à ses 11 millions de clients particuliers et professionnels en France de l’électricité verte, du gaz naturel ainsi que des services #JagisAvecENGIE. 

Au sein de la Direction Marketing et Data de la BU France BtoC, nous recrutons notre Data Scientist en alternance : 

Intitulé du poste Data Scientist en alternance - Lieu de travail(Paris la Défense) 

Tes missions : 

L’alternant(e) réalisera ses missions au sein de l’équipe Data Analytics, équipe dédiée à la réalisation d’études opérationnelles et stratégiques visant à optimiser la valeur du portefeuille clients (exploitation statistique des bases de données, DataScience, segmentation, scoring, modèle prédictif, …) 


Participer à la mise en place d’un environnement d’études sur le datalab, basé sur une plateforme Hadoop. 
Réaliser des études ad hoc à partir de notre base clients sous R ou Python en réponse à une problématique métier. 
Analyser les données disponibles pour en tirer des modèles prospectifs / prédictifs utiles à la compréhension, à l'optimisation et au développement de l'activité commerciale. 
Assurer une veille active sur les nouvelles techniques de machine learning/ deep learning et sur toutes autres méthodes« innovantes » (ex : analyse sémantique, exploitation de données open source, data visualisation, web scraping etc…) 









Qualifications 





Tes compétences : 
De formation E n cycle supérieur au sein d'une école d'ingénieur ou équivalent universitaire avec spécialisation en Data Science en (domaine), tu disposes d es compétences suivantes : 

Connaissance des distributions Hadoop, des langages R, Python, Spark, et SQL. 
Capacité de synthèse et sensibilité marquée pour les chiffres. 


Naturellement tu : 


Vous êtes autonome, méthodique et rigoureux et vous savez faire preuve d’initiative. 
Vous savez travailler avec en équipe et n’hésitez pas valider vos hypothèses avec la responsable Connaissance Client. 

Pourquoi nous rejoindre ? 
Notre promesse : 
Rejoindre la Direction Clients Professionnels (DCP) de la BU France BtoC, c’est participer à la commercialisation de l’électricité et du gaz ainsi que des services associés auprès de petits professionnels tels que les artisans, les commerçants, les restaurants ou encore les agriculteurs ! C’est intégrer une communauté de plus de 150 collaborateurs dynamiques et engagés dans l’accompagnement vers la transition énergétique des clients professionnels. L’aventure te tente ? rejoins nous ! 
Les atouts d’une alternance chez ENGIE : 

La confrontation aux enjeux d’une entreprise mondialement connue 
Une mutuelle 
Le remboursement des transports à hauteur de 50% 
Un comité d’entreprise 
Des solutions d’aide au logement 

En tant qu’employeur responsable, la BU France BtoC valorise la diversité des profils de ses collaborateurs et s’engage en faveur de l’égalité des chances. 







Emploi : Digital / IT/ Data 
  

Lieu principal : Europe-France-Île-de-France-Courbevoie 
  

Organisation : Direction des Clients Professionnels (DCP) 
  

Horaire : Temps plein 
  

Nature de responsabilité : Opérationnel 
  


Publication d'offre : 26 avr. 2022, 09:27:30 
  

Type d'emploi : Alternant

Passionné(e) par la Data Science, possédant une première expérience significative, vous souhaitez débuter une nouvelle aventure ? N'hésitez plus : rejoignez-nous !
Kea est un cabinet de conseil en stratégie et management ambitieux, innovant, en rupture avec les codes traditionnels de la profession. 1er cabinet européen de conseil en stratégie à devenir Société à Mission, certifiés B-Corp depuis 2021, nous sommes des entrepreneurs et partageons tous une vision responsable de l'entreprise - « Entreprendre les transformations pour une économie souhaitable », telle est notre raison d’être.
Nousaccompagnons les directions générales sur 5 champs stratégiques majeurs pensés à l’aune de la responsabilité : réinventer les business modèles, optimiser les modèles opérationnels, repenser les modèles de gouvernance et de structure, redéfinir les modes de management et de leadership, élaborer les routes de transformation.
Nous intervenons sur 4 secteurs clés - Distribution, Grande Consommation, Industrie et Services, et apportons des réponses face aux disruptions actuelles : digital, innovation et transformation responsable.
Nous évoluons au sein d’un groupe interdisciplinaire, international de + de 500 consultants dans 12 pays, source d’ouverture et d’inspiration pour nos clients et nos équipes.
L’équipe Data Science intervient aux côtés des équipes conseil en stratégie de KEA. Elle met les techniques modernes de visualisation, de description et de prédiction de données au service de la résolution de la problématique stratégique du client.

Dans le cadre de son développement, l’équipe Data Science recrute un Data Scientist senior pour mener en autonomie le chantier Data Science de missions de conseil en stratégie KEA.

Vos missions: 

Comprendre la problématique business du client qui aura été formalisée par l’équipe conseil KEA;
Définir le cas d’usage Data Science en collaboration avec l’équipe conseil;
Formaliser la demande d’extraction de données et interagir avec les équipes techniques du client si nécessaire;
Préparer les données pour la modélisation (nettoyage, complétion, etc.);
Explorer les données pour valider que le jeu de données permet d’apporter une réponse au cas d’usage;
Définir, entrainer et évaluer la performance de modèles de Data Science;
Apporter une réponse au cas d’usage en mettant en évidence le degré de confiance dans la réponse ainsi que les limites de l’analyse;
Encadrer un data scientist junior.

Quelle est la valeur ajoutée d'un Data Scientist senior chez Kea ?
Il a le recul sur la Data Science et l’agilité nécessaires pour comprendre rapidement la problématique business du client, formaliser le cas d’usage et mettre en œuvre les techniques et algorithmes pertinents pour apporter une solution valide techniquement et à fort impact business.
Votre profil : 

Bac +5 d’une école d’ingénieur de rang A ou cursus universitaire équivalent.
5 ans d’expérience minimum en tant que Data Scientist.
Français et Anglais niveau courant.
Maitrise de Python et des packages de data science.
Maitrise ou capacité à développer une expertise MS PowerBi.

Le poste est basé au bureau de KEA & PARTNERS situé à Malakoff sur la ligne de métro ligne 13.
Le télétravail ponctuel est accepté.
Rémunération fixe selon expérience de 55-65 K€ + bonus + intéressement + participation.
Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDIStatut : Cadre
Salaire : 55 000,00€ à 65 000,00€ par an
Avantages :

Participation au Transport
RTT
Titre-restaurant

Horaires :

Du Lundi au Vendredi
Travail en journée

Description de l'entreprise

    Oney est une banque différente et unique, née du commerce.
  




   Guidés par nos valeurs, Liberté, Respect, Enthousiasme, nos milliers de talents présents dans 12 pays travaillent jour après jour à donner la possibilité à chacun d’améliorer son quotidien et de mieux consommer.
  




   En créant des solutions de paiement et de financement innovantes nous facilitons la vie de millions de consommateurs et de milliers de commerçants à travers l’Europe. Nous les accompagnons au quotidien pour les aider à faire les bons choix, pour eux comme pour les autres.
  




   Partenaire de la transformation du commerce, à la fois créateur et leader du paiement fractionné en France, Oney est présent sur 5 marchés européens avec cette offre full digitale et omnicanale unique sur le marché.
  




   Nous nous battons depuis plus de trente-cinq ans pour faciliter les achats quotidiens de nos clients en leur offrant plus que le pouvoir d’achat : le pouvoir de choix. Pour leur permettre de mieux gérer leur argent, en le gérant à leur façon et en accord avec leurs convictions.
  




   C’est ce que raconte notre signature : « 
   Your money, your way »
  
 Poste et missions
 Why is it better to be a Data Scientist Open Banking F/H at Oney? More than a job...a mission for you! And what a mission !

 At Oney, the Open Banking Data Science team will establish the groundwork to develop advanced data science models aiming to transform the approach of Oney Group’s lending decisions and customer experience. Its goal will be to deliver innovative methodologies to support the group’s Risk and Data teams, and will result in less risky, more inclusive, and more objective lending practices.

 The Data Scientist will be responsible for building predictive data models, categorization engines and algorithms destined to enrich Open Banking and other open data harvested in our European countries. This role will report to the Data Science Lead and will work closely with Corporate / Local Risk & Data teams.
For this, here are the missions that we propose to you:
Working closely with Data Science Lead & Program Lead Open Banking, as Data Scientist, you will work on creating a new way of lending and a renewed client experience by using Open Banking and other open data. Your will contribute to build and deploy a large range of models and algorithmics, categorization engines, KPIs. Your main stakeholders will be Risk and Data teams across the organization, as well as local and global business leaders
Data Enrichment

Handle massive amounts of data to deliver insights
Propose creative solutions to existing business challenges
Present findings to business leaders
Leverage best practices in machine learning and data engineering to develop scalable solutions.
Build categorization engines for different countries and types of data
Enrich open data by using text learning tools & algorithm


Data Modelling

Contribute, with corporate risk teams, to the creation of a standard models for the launch of internal Open Banking behavioural scoring in different countries
Design, train and implement rule-based and machine learning models / algorithms

Challenge existing sources of scoring, KPIs and categorization
 
Transversal & international coordination

Participate in international meetings with risk & data team in different countries
Collaborate with Corporate Risk and Open Banking Lead to build a deployment roadmap of internal categorization engines, scores, KPIs and new use cases of Open Banking data
Provide expert advice and support to risk & data local teams 

Profil et compétences requises
 What we like most about you is you ! You are methodical and rigorous and passionate about technology. You have a 'start-up' mindset and are known for your creativity and innovative ideas. Approachable and constructive in interpersonal exchanges, you have a strong team spirit.
In your background, we would like to find a training in Engineering or similar with a master’s degree in a relevant field (statistics, machine learning or mathematics) and at least 1 year of experience ideally in building a wide range of machine learning algorithms for lending businesses or related sectors.

Good knowledge of relevant technologies (e.g. SQL, Spark, Jupyter, etc.).
Experience with Data visualization tools (tableau, Qlikview, Microsoft BI, Datawrapper, etc)



Informations complémentaires sur le poste

    Rejoindre Oney, c’est contribuer à changer les modes de consommation pour une société plus équitable et plus responsable, en vous lançant dans une grande aventure au service du pouvoir de choix, de l’humain et de la performance.
  




   Le pouvoir d’inventer le chemin professionnel unique qui ne ressemble qu’à vous. Le choix d’un lieu ouvert aux personnalités et aux divers talents, tous réunis pour créer la consommation de demain tout en facilitant les achats de nos clients au quotidien.
