Wat doe je als Data Scientist bij IVO Rechtspraak?
Dat heb je ook zelf in de hand! Want als Data Scientist bij IVO Rechtspraak werk je in een datalab in oprichting. We maken als onderdeel van de Rechtspraak de Nederlandse rechtspraak digitaal toegankelijk. Met experimenten help jij rechters en andere medewerkers van de Rechtspraak meer datagedreven en dus beter te werken. Daarbij pas je de nieuwste technologieën toe. Spannend en ontzettend belangrijk!
Hoe je werk eruitziet
De Rechtspraak wil flinke stappen zetten in datagedreven werken. Vanuit het IVO Datalab krijg je alle ruimte om daar met experimenten aan bij te dragen. Je eigen team is jong en klein, maar je werkt nauw samen met data-analisten en data scientists van onder meer het datalab van het ministerie van Justitie en Veiligheid en het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut. Genoeg sparringpartners en collega’s dus om nieuwe casussen en data-analyses op te pakken!
Bij het IVO Datalab kun je je creativiteit helemaal kwijt. Samen met collega-data scientists, juridisch medewerkers en rechters ontwikkel je allerlei analyseproducten. Dat gaat van een analyse op de datakwaliteit tot het inzetten van de nieuwste technieken voor natural language processing om relevante tekst uit een uitspraak te halen. En hoe geweldig is het om mee te werken aan een model dat alle uitspraken anonimiseert? Daarmee kunnen we ze online openbaar maken voor het publiek of wetenschappelijk onderzoek.
Aan de hand van experimenten inspireer je medewerkers van de Rechtspraak over de mogelijkheden van datagedreven werken. Zo vergroot je de datageletterdheid binnen de Rechtspraak. Dat betekent natuurlijk ook dat je goed duidelijk moet maken wat er kan en hoe dit helpt om beter te werken. Ook onderwerpen als privacy, ethiek en het operationaliseren van machine learning algoritmes staan op de agenda. Wat zijn bijvoorbeeld de randvoorwaarden om een AI-model in productie te nemen? En hoe houden we rekening met de menselijke maat bij de inzet van algoritmes? Jij denkt er allemaal over mee!
Hou je niet van een gespreid bedje, maar wel van uitdagingen, kansen en de ruimte om je ideeën in de praktijk te brengen? Dan is dit dé baan voor jou!
Wat we je bieden
Om te beginnen een leuke, informele werksfeer. We houden de lijnen graag kort! En je arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn prima geregeld volgens de CAO Rijk. Wat belangrijke punten op een rij:
Je salaris is maximaal € 5.139 op basis van 36-urige werkweek. Je zit in schaal 11.
Je krijgt een Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB) van maximaal € 841 bruto per maand (16,37%). Dit is inclusief je vakantiegeld en eindejaarsuitkering. Je kunt dit budget bijvoorbeeld laten uitkeren of in vrije dagen omzetten.
Je houdt werk en privé prima in balans, bijvoorbeeld door thuis te werken, de mogelijkheid van 4×9 uur of ouderschapsverlof. Bovendien krijg je 144 vakantie- en 21,6 IKB-uren op basis van een 36-urige werkweek.
Binnen de IVO Academy krijg je alle ruimte en is er volop aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke én vaktechnische ontwikkeling.
Bij IVO Rechtspraak stimuleren we reizen met het OV! Je krijgt een OV-chipkaart waarmee je gratis voor je werk reist.
Je pensioen is goed geregeld via het ABP.
Je krijgt in eerste instantie een jaarcontract. Functioneer je goed, dan wordt dit een contract voor onbepaalde tijd.

Meer informatie over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden vind je op www.p-direkt.nl.

Wat we van je vragen
Dit zijn de dingen waar je volgens het ideaalplaatje aan voldoet:
Je hebt minimaal twee jaar relevante werkervaring als Data Scientist
Je hebt uitgebreide kennis en ervaring op het gebied van statistische methodes en technieken, zoals beslisbomen, clustering, named entity recognition en process mining
Je kunt je mondeling en schriftelijk uitstekend uitdrukken: je weet complexe dataprojecten te vertalen naar de business en brengt de uitkomsten van een project helder over aan mensen van verschillende niveaus
Je bent proactief en herkent en creëert op basis van je eigen kennis en ervaring initiatieven voor data science
Je hebt hands-on-ervaring met programmeren in Python (of een vergelijkbare programmeertaal zoals R of Scala)

Kom je bij ons werken, dan vragen we ook altijd een Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag.

Interesse?
Is een baan als Data Scientist bij IVO Rechtspraak iets voor jou? Reageer dan zo snel mogelijk via onderstaande button.
Meer weten? Bel Edwin Visser, Corporate IT Recruiter, via 06 55 48 18 26.
IVO Rechtspraak
Uniceflaan 1
3527 WX Utrecht
Meer weten?
Ben je benieuwd naar ervaringen van onze collega’s of naar onze andere vacatures?
Kijk dan op: www.werkenbijivo.nl

Job Description
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join ING. This team is at the heart of ING, and its systems and algorithms are involved in the large scale of customer interactions. Your eagerness to learn is not only visible in the technical areas but also in how you develop your interpersonal skills. As a creative and curious Data Scientist, you are looking forward to solving a wide variety of real-world business problems. On top of this, you have the programming skills to write quality code that works in production. Machine learning, personalization, and analytics are at the core of what we do. We are looking for experienced data scientists to help us build the next generation of customer interaction experience at ING. Sounds interesting? Please read further.
What you'll do
You’re always thinking one step ahead, for example in advising about the best way of implementation.
You are able to look at things from a different perspective and you are keen on making original solutions work in real-life. Next to being creative, you are also persistent.
If the problem is hard to crack or a technical solution hard to introduce, you keep trying different approaches until you succeed.
You enjoy working in cross-functional teams with ambitious goals, asking fellow team members for assistance, but also helping them out by sharing your knowledge and capabilities.
You have solid communication skills that enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization.
Your enthusiasm and passion are contagious, mobilizing people to capture the tremendous value that Data Science brings to customers of ING.
How to succeed
At least 1 year of relevant applied experience
MSc or Ph.D. with excellent academic results in the field of Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields
Experience in working in an Agile/Scrum way would be great
Machine Learning: Deep Learning, Classification, Regression, Clustering, Text Mining. You have an excellent understanding of Neural Networks, Random Forests, Logistic Regression, SVM, KNN, K-Means, LDA, etc. Experience with model validation is a plus
Programming Languages and Tools: python, Git, PyCharm, Shell scripting or similar. Web development is a nice-to-have
Analytics tooling: pySpark, Hadoop, SQL, Netezza, Jupyter Notebook or similar. Working with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Tensorflow) is a nice-to-have
Analytical and content strength (in DS work field): sees which DS techniques apply to the business problem at hand and is able to structure the approach. Writes readable, concise and efficient code
Willingness to learn: open to feedback and development on both technical and interpersonal levels
Perseverance: does not give up when a problem is demanding, knows how to deal with setbacks
Strong communication skills: written and spoken English needs to be convincing. Active on social media about data science is a nice-to-have
Entrepreneurial skills: takes ownership and makes it happen
What we offer
A job from 36 to 40 hours in a challenging environment where you use the latest technology to make an impact. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.
To give you an idea, these are some of the benefits of working at ING:
Ambition to become the best Data Scientist team (in Banking)
Great salary and other terms
National or global career possibilities
Great mix in research, strategic, operational & entrepreneurial assignments
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days
Pension scheme
13th month salary
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
8% Holiday payment
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best
Based in Amsterdam, of course in “hybrid mode”, working from home and office as best fits the nature of the work.
Questions?
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Can you identify with this profile? Then apply and become a Data Scientist at ING.
As part of your application, we kindly request that you upload a document with a sample of your code, this is necessary for us to be able to assess your application. Please note that for this role no Relocation Package is provided.
About us
With around 52,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to make a diﬀerence. We hire smart people like you for your potential, not your past. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on more responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself. If you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible, surrounded by progressive, inspiring and supportive colleagues, there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

Would you like to join crew of sharp analytical minds? We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our global team of highly skilled data scientists. We share the common passion to work with massive amount of data and deliver complex analyses and solutions, contributing towards Nordea’s digital transformation journey. A great day for us - Applying analytics to solve day-to-day banking problems using the latest technologies, big data, math & statistics.

At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

Your Future Responsibilities are:

Welcome to an organization located in the Nordics and Poland with a wide range of profiles, from data scientists, engineers and statisticians to economists, researchers and IT. We add value by attracting and retaining talented high performers by being front runners in our area of expertise. We take ownership for our own development and the development of our business, and we expand competences through learning loops in a creative and appreciative rapid prototyping culture. We believe in high performing teams where everyone plays a role in reaching out for our mission to deliver world class analytics.

What you’ll be doing:

As a data scientist, you will help business areas to resolve data-intensive decisioning problems through application of data processing and modelling. Provide insights and recommendations through data analysis. Contribute to driving intelligent automation by through algorithmic and model-based solutions.

Collaborate with stakeholders and colleagues on using data to resolve a broad spectrum of business problems. Support and engage in teams discussions related to requirements, quality of data and methods for data manipulation
Gather requirements, extract, process and prepare data in an efficient manner for further analysis and modelling
Extract knowledge from data through visualisation, analysis and interpretation. Contribute to the dialogue on next steps towards business goals
Engage in development and prototyping of Machine Learning models to resolve identified business needs.
Make assessment and validation of model performance in development phase. Engage in optimizing the code for further steps towards model deployment
Process data according to Nordea’s data management principles and regulations. Follow AI lifecycle milestones in model development phase

You’ll join centre of excellence in Advanced Analytics team (unit of Group Data Management Office), driving Nordea’s goal towards omni-channel experience for Personal Banking customers

The role is based in Oslo, Norway.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that:
You have an excellent analytical skill and can influence others with your presentation and communication skill
You are driven by achieving concrete results and see your work leading to direct business value
You follow structured, creative & forward looking approach
You are self-driven, proactive and consult experts to take decisions in complex scenarios
You are willing to develop new skills & capabilities by working with other data scientists and leaning on Nordea’s proposed Learning framework.

Your experience and background:
You have experience working on data science projects delivering tangible benefits/outcome in the enterprise set up
You have experience processing the data in big data environment and have an understanding of associated challenges and way around while working with unstructured and real life data set up
You are comfortable in using one or more data science programming language i.e Python, Pyspark, R, SQL etc.
You have academic credentials focused on related data science field: mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering and information management etc. and you have strong understanding of statistical concepts (e.g. Hypothesis Testing) and machine learning models i.e reinforced learning, NLP, Random forest etc.
You are proficient in written and spoken English

Even better if :
You have delivered or worked in the area of automated decisioning, recommendation engine etc.
You have knowledge of basic digital marketing principles and familiarity with Nordic banking market in general
You have prior experience working in productionalized set up in-premise or cloud environment
You know your ways around tools like IBM Watson (Watson Studio), BitBucket, Hive, Unix Systems, visualization tool such as power BI, QlikSense
You have worked in SAFe agile environment

If this sounds like you, get in touch!


Next steps

Submit your application no later than 15/05/2022. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Alok Kumar, +45 23998600, alok.kumar@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

post_title: PwC Trust Solutions is looking for ambitious Data Scientists
description:
Join us in reimagining how we can build trust in society and solve important problems

In an increasingly complex world, we help intricate systems function, adapt and evolve so they can benefit communities and society – whether they are capital markets, tax systems or the economic systems within which business and society exist.

In PwC Trust Solutions trust experts – from finance and legal to sustainability – come together with technologists to create digital products that enable our trust service deliveries and directly solve our customers’ trust challenges. We’re looking to strengthen our Tech team with skilled and motivated Data Scientists with 0-4 years of experience.

The job

PwC Trust Solutions has a team of tech-savvy consultants working to strengthen PwC’s trust services with advanced analytics and innovative technologies – and help discover tomorrow’s ways of delivering trust through digital products.

We are passionate about helping our clients utilize descriptive-, predictive-, and prescriptive analytics. Our go-to tools include machine learning, process mining, dashboarding and microservices. We deliver bespoke analytics, often leading to prototyping/piloting of data driven/AI-products.

A career as a technologist in Trust Solutions will provide you with the opportunity to learn from a wide range of domains and grow your analytical skills. In addition to internal and external training and learning opportunities, there is an important element of learning on the job to further develop your personal and the team’s capabilities.

As a Data Scientist in Trust Solutions, you will

Extract and clean data from client systems
Create valuable insight from data with advanced analytics
Automate and optimize client processes
Participate in relevant analytics and data networks across the company nationally and globally
Work and collaborate closely with engineers and domain experts in PwC Trust Solutions, Tax & Legal Services, and Advisory

Desired qualifications

Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics, business or related field
0-4 years of relevant work experience
Strong analytical approach to problem solving
Excellent communication skills and a proactive attitude
Self-driven and highly motivated individual
Knowledge of or a high interest to learn some of the following:
Python and/or R
Applied Machine Learning
Cloud Services (Azure / AWS / GCP)
Databases and SQL
Process mining (Celonis)
Business intelligence tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Alteryx )
Agile, DevOps methodologies
Ability to explain your work to less technical audiences
Ability to work in a fast paced, multi-disciplinary and constantly changing environment
This position requires a fluent level of Norwegian and English.

We can offer

Mac or PC – your choice
Modern offices in Oslo’s Bjørvika district
Access to collaboration with leading domain experts from a diverse range of professional services areas, including Auditing, Legal, Cyber security, Forensic investigations, Sustainability and CFO services.
Competitive terms
Internal and external training and learning opportunities, in addition to on the job learning

Application deadline: We select applicants continuously until 22nd of May

Start date: As soon as possible

Place of employment: Oslo, Norway

Contact information: Camilla Haukeberg / camilla.haukeberg@pwc.com / +47 950 16 411

Website: PwCs karrieresider: www.pwc.no/karriere

According to GDPR, you are requested to apply through the system and not directly to the contact person(s) listed in this ad.


Senior Data Analyst | 27

I started my career in PwC Assurance almost three years ago after finishing my degree within big data and economics. After two years of working in Audit, I found my professional interest to tend towards analytics, programming and development. As a result I was hired into PwC TechLabs as a consultant. Now I get to work both with complex and interesting problems by solving client cases through analytics and optimization, as well as internal projects to digitize how PwC delivers values to its customers.

Up until very recently spent one and a half months solving a client's dispute with a supplier using python and advanced modeling. I also get to do the best of both worlds as I am not only on client engagements but also play a key role in prototyping PwC products. This is one of the aspects I love about my job, as I get to spend a lot of time on trial and error while developing applications using Azure and other tools - as long as there is a feasible business case to be made. In TechLabs you also get to enjoy autonomy as the organizational structure is lean and you often have responsibility for your own projects. While at the same time I can always brainstorm with my colleagues if I am feeling stuck.

Data Scientist | 27

I have a background as an Industrial and Management Systems Engineer and all previous work experience was mostly within Supply Chain. Upon finishing my masters degree I wanted to get more into data analytics, but this can be a hard sell with relatively sparse coding experience and little knowledge of the softwares used in the field. Fortunately PwC saw my potential and the willingness to learn, and I was brought on as a Data Analyst.

Since then I have been exposed to numerous new technologies and related challenges and I am enjoying the ever expanding expanse of learning opportunities . Our team works fast paced and you are constantly working with new projects. The backlog of projects has allowed me to cherry pick several of my projects, so that I could work with customers or technology I wanted to be exposed to. Continuous learning is both a perk and a must in this job, but you are not alone. At PwC you are a part of a strong Technology community among many more consultants and there’s almost always someone that has already been exposed to some variety of the challenges you are facing. In addition, I have experienced a large amount of freedom in how, when and where I work. Being able to tailor the workday to your own needs is definitely another perk of this job.

Senior Data Scientist | 29

After finishing my degree in Computational Physics, I wanted to broaden my horizon and get to know more about the different industries out there, while at the same time applying the knowledge I had acquired. That is why I chose PwC. As a multidisciplinary professional services firm you will work together with experts on projects across sectors where your expertise will be one piece of the puzzle that is the final solution.

During my time at PwC I have discovered that I really enjoy working together with domain experts and finding new ways to solve their problems. We do not specialize in any particular tools, but choose the ones that best fit the business case. This requires you to be creative, open and willing to learn new things. I have explored business cases and prototyped new services and products related to tax, sustainability and forensics, among others.
Kontaktpersoner:
Camilla Haukeberg
+47 950 16 411
camilla.haukeberg@pwc.com

info_remote: TRANS EU GROUP S A - Wrocław, dolnośląskie
description:
Data Scientist

Kogo szukamy?

Data Scientist,
Pasjonatów danych, mających pierwsze doświadczenie w obszarze Data Science zdobyte na studiach, w pracy zawodowej lub w prywatnych projektach,
Osób chcących doskonalić umiejętności programowania w języku Python.

Twój zakres obowiązków:

Zbieranie, przetwarzanie i przede wszystkim analizowanie danych dotyczących giełdy przewoźników/załadowców itp z całego świata,
Prace badawcze i wykorzystanie zaawansowanej analityki w celu lepszego poznania zachowań,
Udział w procesach zapewniających odpowiednią jakość i kompletność danych (Data Lake),
Projektowanie i wdrażanie automatyzacji w procesach biznesowych i analitycznych,
Przeanalizujesz duże zbiory danych (używając SQLa i/lub Pythona),
Poznawanie i rozwijanie warstw danych (big data, small data, all data)

Zależy Nam na:

Silnych umiejętnościach analitycznych i podejściu do pracy polegającym na rozwiązywaniu problemów,
Wysoko rozwiniętych umiejętnościach analitycznych i statystycznych,
Dobrej i praktycznej znajomość języka Python,
Znajomości bibliotek Pandas, Numpy itp.,
Znajomości relacyjnych baz danych i języka SQL.

Umiejętności mile widziane przez Nas to:

Zainteresowanie nauką o danych i chęć poznawania nowych narzędzi i rozwiązań,
Chęć nauki środowiska Aws i Snowflake.


Chcemy, abyś robił to, co sprawia Ci najwięcej radości, ale na pewno ucieszysz się dodatkowo z:

prywatnej opieki medycznej,
karty Multisport,
pysznych, domowych śniadań,
relaksujących masaży odciążających kręgosłup,
eventów integrujących zespół,
voucherów podarunkowych i bonów świątecznych,
ośrodka wczasowego nad jeziorem do dyspozycji pracowników,
jednorazowych dopłat do żłobka i przedszkola,
dopłat do wczasów pod gruszą,
zajęć i sekcji sportowych, organizowanych w firmie i poza nią.

Brzmi dobrze? Aplikuj!

The Role:
Building AI software to target ads to individual users in a high traffic environment.
A full-time Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer position for an exceptional candidate who has a keen interest in multivariate modelling, machine learning and decision automation. You will be designing and building machine learning systems that will operate on real-world data making decisions in real-time. You will be working in the highly exciting area of real-time ad targeting.
This is a rare opportunity to be involved in creating an automated system to optimize hundreds of real-time interactions per second with online customers, and to quantify the benefits created against control groups in a live environment.
The work involves analysing billions of records of ad-serving opportunities, ad-serves and ad-server responses to understand what factors explain the variance in the expected response value. That understanding is then to be harnessed as an automated optimisation process capable of intelligently finding and servicing the most favourable ad-serving opportunities in a way that leads to higher returns on our clients’ advertising investments.
This is also an opportunity to become part of the UK tech start-up world and get first-hand experience into how tech start-ups operate.
Key Responsibilities:
You will report to the Chief Data Scientist and join a team of other data scientists, senior data scientists and data engineers to solve tough (but never dull) problems, such as:
Prototyping machine learning algorithms using cutting edge research
Developing applications to visualise and manipulate huge amounts of data
Ability to write production-ready code to handle many terabytes of data
Maintain and improve existing products and processes
Working to support the following steps in the analytical process with large (a multi-million record) data sets:
Basic data cleansing and preparation
Variable preprocessing/transformation
Performing statistical tests
Generation of graphical output
Preparation of data sets for predictive modelling
Robust predictive model building, validation and application
Automation of statistical processes
We are a small, highly interactive team working in an Agile environment where we prototype and then put into production machine learning solutions to solve real business problems. You will be involved with all stages of the development lifecycle from brainstorming ideas to the release of production quality code.
You will need strong communication skills. You will also be expected to care deeply about the quality of your code: its clarity, documentation, and testing.
Key Skills & Experience:
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in a mathematical discipline such as Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Maths, Engineering or Physics
1+ years experience in Python
Working knowledge of R
Good experience of variable transformation and data preprocessing techniques.
Solid practical knowledge of different modelling techniques and a good grasp of the strengths and weaknesses of each. (Modelling techniques such as Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Naive Bayes, Clustering, etc.)
Bonus Qualifications:
Practical experience of univariate and multivariate statistical analysis in R or Python with large data sets (millions of records and many tens or hundreds of independent variables)
Experience of Adtech
Experience in agile software development
Technologies: Elasticsearch, Clickhouse, Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform
Experience with various messaging systems, such as Kafka
About you:
Strong self-motivation, reliable and flexible team-player
High attention to details, ability to remain focused under pressure
Proactive attitude towards improving processes and finding new solutions to challenging business problems
As Data Scientist, you will be able to combine your expertise in Mathematics, Statistics, and Coding in tackling complex data problems whilst being comfortable in a job requiring agility, curiosity, and continuous improvement. We are looking for someone who can very quickly grasp technical concepts and understand how to rapidly solve problems associated with them. The ideal candidate will examine data from many perspectives, be able to think out of the box and efficiently communicate ideas and findings to technical and non-technical peers equally. A passion for new technologies and a drive to find simple and elegant ways to implement simple solutions to complex problems is key.

info_remote: Diverse Consulting Group - Opole, łódzkie - Remote
description:
DCG is a modern technology company, gathering in its ranks IT related professionals. Due to the continuous development and the large number of recruitment projects that we carry out for our Partners, we are looking for a person for the position:
Senior Data Scientist

Delegating tasks to Junior and Mid level Data
Scientists and providing them with guidance

Our Team:

Is a cross-functional Data team made up of data scientists, data and software architects, software engineers and business reporting analysts spanning the globe
Works on analytics project based on the company's business requirements on different domain such as NLP and time series prediction and analysis
Has ownership over data company-wide, from analytics to global business reporting
Manages the entire data lifecycle from extraction to visualization
Works in SQL, Python, R, scikit-learn, Google Cloud BigQuery, Java and C++ and are always prototyping new technologies

Who You Are:

You're looking for an opportunity to work with great people in energetic and open company culture. You enjoy collaborating across many different disciplines within a company to help drive towards a common goal. You're as passionate about building efficient solutions and driving high-level impact to the business. You're curious about what makes a company succeed; to you, data is not just the answer, but a means to ask more questions.

Build statistical, predictive, and machine learning models
Collection, review, perform cleansing and reporting of data
Help our Marketing, Strategy, Product, Sales, Customer Service, and Trading teams drive growth in the business

Experience in time series modeling, developing custom algorithms, and Machine Learning

Basecone, a Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting Europe company, is a vibrant and dynamic place to work.
We push boundaries and challenge each other every day. We collaborate across disciplines, trying to achieve that common goal: to develop, launch and maintain state-of-the-art Solutions. Solutions that effectively address real business problems and provide the best customer experience out there. Solutions that you and your team can be proud of at the end of the day.
At Basecone we believe our people are the heart and soul of our company. We value everyone’s input and believe in a commonly agreed commitment. We offer a no-nonsense environment, in which professionalism, fun and open communication are key elements.
About the role:
We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our team.
The ideal candidate has experience with predictive problems; in designing and developing Machine Learning solutions; proficiency in Training/Testing/Tuning ML models; has good knowledge in Deep Learning algorithms. You will work closely with Machine Learning engineers and Data Engineers to promote the best experience for data science explorations and development of ML-based products.
Qualifications:
Degree in Computer Engineering, IT or similar field;Minimum of 1 year of working experience as a Data Scientist;Ability to write robust code in Python;Knowledge of Computer Vision and NLP techniques;Knowledge in SQL/NoSQL;Knowledge of Data Science frameworks like Scikit-Learn, Pandas, TensorFlow, PyTorch;Nice to have knowledge of AWS solutions for Data Science;Experience on the developing E2E processes for building/deploying AI models;Excellent communication and decision-making skills;Fluency in English.
What we offer:
Very competitive salary. We want to build a great team, and we want to get those who are the best at what they doWork with a perfect knowledge balanced team, across The Netherlands and PortugalExperience working for an international company, with a strong focus on the actual IT working methodologies and mentalityA working environment where your team and manager understands that it’s important to spend time thinking on a solution, rather than rushing into the first one that comes to mind; an environment where refactoring and rebuilding are seen as sometimes necessary; an environment where the team is the one truly responsible for coming up with a solution, rather than implement one that was imposed.
How to apply:
If we got your curiosity, we now hope to ignite your attention and enthusiasm! We would love to hear from you, please apply via the button below.

Job Description:
Life at Grab
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.
Get to know the Team
The Data Science (Geo Vision) team at Grab focuses on improving the maps and building map-based intelligence such as localization, routing, travel time estimation, traffic forecasting, that assist various Grab services like transportation, logistics, and pricing. We extensively use Computer Vision, NLP, Information Retrieval, and Text Mining along with conventional machine learning methods on a variety of signals including images, videos, text, sensor readings, GPS probes, etc to understand our locations and road networks. We also support the development of innovative, highly scalable, models through deep research and advanced analysis so that we make our products intelligent and delight our customers. We foster a culture where we enjoy raising the bar constantly for ourselves and others, and that strongly supports the freedom to explore and innovate.
Get to know the Role
We are looking for a senior data scientist to help automate the process of map creation using data science techniques. We believe a successful candidate has very good modern computer vision skills and strong deep learning expertise, but if you believe you have what it takes then we’d love to hear from you either way. This role is required because of the very fast pace of change in the SE-Asia environment impacting deeply the maps. In return, you will get an opportunity to grow in a very challenging environment requiring innovation and creativity.
The Day-to-Day Activities:
Understand business needs, identify areas for investigation, translate them to technical problems to be solved
Design and develop innovative architectures to address the emerging demands of computer vision and machine learning algorithms.
Collaborate across the company, working with software, engineering, and product teams.
Deploy solutions into production systems, and also ensure maintenance and required updates
The Must-Haves:
A solid understanding and experience with Deep Learning, in particular with design, training, evaluation, and optimization of convolutional neural net (CNN) architectures in the context of object detection, segmentation, scene classification, object tracking, OCR, etc.
Experience with Python and some of the following libraries: PyTorch, Tensorflow or Fast.ai; NumPy; OpenCV; scikit-learn;
Understanding of machine learning methods for classification, regression, and clustering.
Linear algebra and matrix transformations
Self-motivated learner who keeps himself up-to-date with the current state of computer vision and deep learning techniques/architectures.
Able to communicate well in English both verbally and in written communication, as well as convey data insights and results with effective visualizations.
The Nice-to-Haves:
Good knowledge of attention and transformer networks would be a strong plus
Experience in curating, manipulating, and analyzing large geographical or spatio-temporal datasets.
Experience in designing, deploying or maintaining ML systems in production
Familiarity with Azure Kubernetes Service
Familiarity with GIS frameworks and/or databases (e.g. PostGIS).
Familiarity with Azure cloud platform
Our Commitment
We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.
About Grab
Grab is the leading superapp platform in Southeast Asia, providing everyday services that matter to consumers. Today, the Grab app has been downloaded onto millions of mobile devices, giving users access to over 9 million drivers, merchants, and agents. Grab offers a wide range of on-demand services in the region, including mobility, food, package and grocery delivery services, mobile payments, and financial services across 428 cities in eight countries.
Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.

Enterprise Technology has created a new AI R&D unit at Accenture Global IT. The team is currently looking for a talented and passionate Data Scientist.
Why is working with us interesting?
Are you interested in joining a team that will push a tech vision across the enterprise over the next 5 years?
We’re innovators, researchers, and concept designers. We investigate emerging technologies to identify upcoming trends around Analytics, AI, and Big Data and then apply them to new business models within Accenture.
What would be my role?
As Data scientist, you will have the opportunity to work in an exciting and dynamic environment. You will be responsible for the creation of forward thinking and disruptive concepts, ideas, roadmaps, and prototypes.
You will collaborate with major cloud providers (AWS, Google and Azure) and niche cutting edge domain vendors to shape Accenture’s AI strategy.
Who you´ll work with…
You´ll work closely with various internal teams and group´s Strategy leaders to shape Accenture´s future around AI/ML and Advanced Analytics. The results of you work will transform and disrupt the way how data is being used within the company at a global scale.
We are part of CIO family called Enterprise Technology – Vision and Strategy that exists to shape Accenture´s internal Technology future.

What we are looking for…Masters or Data Science/Statistics/Computer Science/Applied Mathematics or related fields plus 2-3 years applied analytics.Applied Analytics and/or research experience in disruptive and new technologies.Predictive models and clustering (segmentation), as well as NLP, with deep expertise in one or more frameworks/libraries such as: Scikit learn, NLTK, SciPy, numpy, Pandas, TLC, Keras, TensorFlow, CNTK, H2O, Caffe, PyTorch, Pyspark, or R.Experience in translating non-trivial business requirements into data science solution, developing and deploying models (preferably to cloud based environments) and presenting outcomesStrong team player that is flexible and creative learning and delivering in different technologies.Ability to learn and lead with minimal oversight and work on several research projects at the same time.Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environment.Excellent leadership, communication (written and oral), and interpersonal skills.Ability to simplify and explain complex topics to stakeholders and non-technical audience.Strong organizational skills.
What would also help…Experience with infrastructure related analytics.Enjoy discovering, testing, and researching Data science technologies and being able to share results and best practices via whitepapers, blogs, townhalls...
· Passion and curiosity for new techniques, technologies, and industry trends (i.e., Deep learning, analytics advisors, synthetic data, Digital Twin, VR/AR Analytics, Metaverse, etc.) · AIOps/MLOps · Solution Arch DesignEthical AI frameworks
What you can expect…Being an integral part of an innovative organization that explores and tests cutting edge technologies.Joining a team that invests in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, mentorships, conferences, and an O'Reilly/Pluralsight subscription)Having fun and working with a multicultural team that is dedicated to ensuring a positive work/life balanceFlexible working from home/officeWork from home support (mindfulness tools, flexible working hours, VR events)

Right now, we are looking for a Data Scientist! I am Sarah S-Latef Engström and I am leading the Telia B2B team for E-commerce & Customer Value Management.
We are currently on a very exciting journey towards industry leading 1-to-1 marketing-automated, with a new Martech-stack in place enabling us to use new features, functions & data.
Our mission is to bring personalized communication to our B2B customers WHERE, WHEN and HOW they expect it. We are passionate about our customers and believe that staying connected with them through relevant communication is key to a great customer experience.
Is this your next opportunity?
The role includes, but is not limited to:
Responsibility for data sourcing and follow-ups of our marketing automation journeys
Building powerful and easy to use performance dashboards
Building automations and predictive models for our marketing automation campaigns
Developing and articulating data analysis and presenting them to stakeholders
Utilizing a strong business acumen: deep knowledge of how to design KPIs, diagnostic metrics and benchmarks, including how to set effective targets to drive optimal outcomes
Creating scorings models for our marketing automation campaigns
Being a key player in personalize campaign communication through developing next best action engine

Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!

About this opportunity
We are now looking for RAN Data Scientist to join the team in Kista, Sweden. You will join a highly motivated team with expert knowledge in the blend of Radio Network and Data Science. You will have a great opportunity to grow and evolve your own skills and know-how working with state-of-the-art RAN AI solutions.
The Base Band Analytics section is a Radio Access Network (RAN) System organization responsible for driving the RAN AI product development targeting the Ericsson 4G/LTE and 5G/NR RAN Products. The responsibility and focus are on identifying and developing RAN solutions applying Machine Learning techniques and driving the RAN AI evolution to enable the integration of these technologies into the 4G and 5G products. It also includes spreading and growing the AI competence within the Development Organization and to facilitate data-driven development. The Analytics section is also responsible for the Smartphone Lab Program, supporting Ericsson's business and the product development by providing industry-unique and customer-relevant insights based on analysis of current and future end-user applications.

What you will do
Understand, adapt and apply machine learning and AI techniques to provide Radio Access Network solutions and functionality.
Define and conduct RAN product development studies with a focus on solutions based on Machine Learning/AI modeling and support the implementation into the 4G and 5G Radio Network and Network Management products
Use, maintain and evolve RAN simulation environments and AI tools for the development and evaluation of machine learning and AI solutions in the RAN context
Perform lab and live network data analysis to understand the RAN functional behavior to identify and develop RAN solutions and for Machine Learning/AI modeling

You will bring
M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering / Engineering Physics / Wireless communication systems, or equivalent
Deep understanding of Mobile Network and Radio Access technologies in general and LTE and 5G in particular,
Deep understanding of the Physical Layer, RRM, or Traffic Control (L1, L2, L3) of 4G and 5G
Deep understanding of AI and ML techniques, theoretical as well as practical
Have good programming skills (e.g. Java, C++, Python)
Experience in using AI/ML tools and IT systems
Good analytical and data mining skills
Practical experience from RAN Product Development in System Design and Concept Development roles

Application
As the selection process and interviews are ongoing, we encourage you to send your application in English as soon as you can. Placement in Stockholm, Sweden. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Sofia Kolbovich at sofia.kolbovich@ericsson.com or Hiring Manager Ulf Norholm at ulf.norholm@ericsson.com. Note that we cannot process applications sent via email.

Why join Ericsson?
At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

What happens once you apply?

We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.

info_remote: Equifax - 918 reviews - Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires
description:
Equifax is looking for an experienced Data Scientist, who will be responsible for attributes development, testing, and delivery with Python in our technical environment, leveraging advanced data and analytical methodologies, AI, ML/DL to design and deliver attributes bundles based on use cases.
This individual is also capable of data delivery, design of data structures (AVRO schema), and processes balancing immediate deliverables with future reusability, while evangelizing best practices for data solution architecture. This individual will promote a culture of creativity, problem-solving, experimentation, innovation, and execution. The ability to be detail-oriented, highly organized, and priority-driven are a must in order to be successful in this fast-paced environment.
What You’ll Do
Be a part of the Attributes Development team that works closely with cross-functional teams across D&A and technology within the organization.
Integrate single or/and multiple data sources, data types and data structures into solutions and work with key stakeholders and understand their needs to develop advanced solutions or improve existing solutions around data and analytics.
Develop attributes in a Python-based development environment. Perform testing, attributes reduction, use cases design and execution with advanced statistical technologies and algorithms. Deliver attributes and scorecard insights and bundle solutions. Assist in implementing attribute solutions in production environments.
Be responsible for data delivery, design of data structures, and processes balancing immediate deliverables with future reusability, while evangelizing best practices for data solution architecture.
Qualifications
3-5 years of professional experience as a data scientist or statistical modeler in at least one of the following: identity and fraud, credit risk, telecommunications, financial services, payment, ecommerce, B2B or B2C, marketing, insurance, or security analytics arena.
Mastery in Python and SQL is a must.
Excellent problem solving skills which may include data delivery, design of data structures, data cleaning, data mining, data clustering, modeling, and pattern recognition methodologies
Master’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science , Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics or other related discipline
Extra Points for any of the Following
Knowledge of credit bureau data and FCRA regulated data would be preferred
Knowledge of Google Cloud platform and BigQuery

April 26, 2022
Apply your deep expertise in data science, machine learning to business problems
Work to establish an advanced environment with a tight knit team and propel their data science journey
Don’t fret, this team has executive level sponsorship for driving decisions with data
About the Culture

Inclusive workspace and workforce that will accept you for you and not expect you to fit a “cookie cutter mould”
Amazing leadership team to learn from that will encourage autonomy, elevate your skill level and encourage you to try new things
Flexilbity in ways of working and high levels of collaboration within the business when it comes to being data driven

Select features, build and optimise classifiers using machine learning techniques
Process, cleanse and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Interface with numerous departments to deliver insights that lead to process improvements and enhance the effectiveness of data-driven decision making
Advise various analytical teams to increase application of relevant methodologies to test and solve business problems
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
Actively search for use cases for predictive analysis to solve business problems
Focus on developing ML models that cover customer lifetime value, churn predicition, recommender systems etc

Experience Required

You must have used R or Python in a commercial landscape
Pyspark experience is near essential, however those without it may not be ruled out

post_title: Chapter Lead - Data Scientist (Capital Management & Financial Modelling)
info_remote: ANZ Banking Group - 1,159 reviews - Sydney NSW
description:
About the role 
 

Hybrid: Melbourne/Sydney Preferred 
 
 12 Month Fixed Term Contract, with potential to lead into future opportunites 
 
 At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving our customers’ financial wellbeing so they can achieve incredible things – be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small. 
 
 In the ANZLMI team we support the ANZ Home Loans business to assist people who want to buy a liveable, affordable and sustainable home. The ANZLMI purpose is to assist ANZ offer the best home ownership experience. ANZLMI is a separate legal entity and holds an APRA general insurance license and an ASIC Australian Credit License. 
 
 We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join the ANZLMI team bringing experience in data management and managing the ongoing delivery of capital management, pricing and reinsurance strategies. 
 
 This role leads the Data Science team to prepare monthly business and other MIS reporting for the ANZLMI business, and provides ongoing exposure to the ANZLMI Board of Directors and other ANZ Group (Treasury/Risk) functions. 
 
 What will your day look like 
 
 The role is responsible for managing the - 
 
 ANZLMI Pricing and Reinsurance Strategies to ensure they remain appropriate and fit for purpose; 
 
 ANZLMI ICAAP framework, including delivery of ongoing stress testing and capital management requirements; and 
 
 Development and oversight of business analytical tools that support management to optimise the business performance. 
 
 Other accountabilities include - 
 
 Monitor and review ANZLMI’s capital management activities to manage regulatory requirements and optimise return on capital; 
 
 Delivery of the annual Pricing review; Reinsurance program design and ICAAP stress testing exercise (including preparation of ICAAP Report); 
 
 Development of Portfolio Analytics framework to support monitoring of emerging risks and drive a greater understanding of the LMI portfolio; 
 
 Ongoing portfolio review and proactive identification of policy opportunities and / or concerns; 
 
 Close engagement with Risk & Finance on new business and loss forecasts, along with regulatory capital calculation methodologies; and 
 
 Alignment and compliance with ANZ Retail and wider Group processes, policies and strategy 
 
 What will you bring? 
 
 To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following: 
 
 Strong analytical, financial and accounting background - including understanding of prudential, capital and provisioning requirements for Australian lenders and insurers. 
 

Tertiary qualification in either: Accounting/Finance/Quantitative discipline. A professional qualification in Accounting/Finance (ie CA/CPA/CFA) or actuarial will be well regarded. 
 
 Background in finance and/or risk management will also be highly regarded - along with previous experience in the insurance industry 
 
 Ability to meet deadlines & prioritise to cope with competing priorities 
 
 Strong communication and people management skills – previous experience presenting to executive committees and/or Boards will be well regarded 
 
 People Management – ability to develop an engaged and highly motivated Data Science team 
 
 Stakeholder Management – Building relationships by educating, partnering and influencing. Expected to influence all levels throughout the organisation. 
 
 You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture and we actively encourage people to try new things. 
 
 So if this role interests you and you feel you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you! 
 
 So, why join us? 
 
 We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human-centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter. We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong. 
 
 A happy workplace is a thriving one, and some of the perks you’ll get from being at ANZ are: 
 
 Lifestyle leave - top up your annual leave with up to four weeks of additional purchased leave or take a longer period of unpaid time off 
 
 Great discounts on our financial products, and an annual Superannuation top up payment of $500 for all female employees to address the Superannuation gender gap 
 
 Competitive parental leave policies for both mums and dads, with a lump sum childcare contribution when you return to work 
 
 We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support. 
 
 Interested in joining us? 
 
 Click Apply Now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities. 
 
 This role is required to work from an ANZ workplace. Under the Victorian Government’s COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions, the successful candidate will need to provide evidence that they have received two doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine, or have a medical exemption evidenced by an authorised medical practitioner, in order to be appointed to the role. 
 

Please Note: After your initial application you may be asked to complete an online assessment, this invite will be sent to you via email from our assessment partner SHL. Please action this request as early as possible, this will enable us to manage your application and provide you with an update in a timely manner. 
 
 Job Posting End Date 
 
 10/05/2022, 11.59pm, (Melbourne Australia)

description:
The Data Science team at Signifyd builds the models that power our fraud detection engine. Our machine learning pipeline keeps us one step ahead of fraudsters and their constantly evolving tactics and our research and experiments develop into new products that improve the merchant payments experience.We expect our data scientists to be hands-on. We carry solutions from a brainstorm to experimentation and all the way to deployment. We're a varied group with a diversity of strengths - some team members came to us from academic backgrounds, others from engineering, some from big companies and some from small, but all of us are curious and collaborative.We are looking for someone who embodies our company values:Curious and Hungry: Be willing to do research and design experiments by being hands-onTenacious: Creating something new is hard work, and our Data Scientist team never gives upCustomer Passion: Be the backbone to our platform, and help us stay ahead of fraudstersDesign for Scale: Work with the rest of the Data Science team to make fraud protection at scale possibleAgile: Some days you may spend doing research and designing experiments while others are spent using your analytical toolbox to surface insights into real-time fraud attacks.Roll Up Your Sleeves: Partner closely internally to learn from others, and succeed as a teamHow you'll have an impact: 

Building production machine learning models that identify fraud
Designing new algorithms that optimize all the key components of the Signifyd Commerce Protection Platform
Writing production and offline analytical code in Python and Java
Researching real-time emerging fraud patterns with the Risk Analysis team
Working with distributed data pipelines
Communicating complex ideas effectively to a variety of audiences
Collaborating with engineering teams to continuously strengthen our machine learning pipeline
Mentoring other members of the team

Past experience you'll need: 

Bachelor's degree in computer science, applied mathematics, economics, or an analytical field
An advanced degree (M.S. or Ph.D) in an analytical field is a plus
At least 3+ years of experience
Hands-on statistical analysis with a solid fundamental understanding
Designing experiments and collecting data
Writing code and reviewing others' in a shared codebase, preferably in Python and Java
Practical SQL knowledge
Familiarity with the Linux command line
Fluent in English

Experience we love to see: 

Data analysis in a distributed environment
Passion for writing well-tested production-grade code
Using visualizations to communicate analytical results to stakeholders outside your team
Previous work in fraud, payments, or e-commerce

#LI-Remote
Job Type: Full-time

Who We Are
Provenir is a global fintech company with offices across North America, the UK, and Singapore. Provenir helps fintechs, financial institutions, and payment providers make smarter decisions, faster. We are passionate about technology and empowering businesses to become industry leaders. As a leading provider of decisioning and analytics products for financial services and other industries, we empower businesses to create digital-first decisioning solutions that drive business growth. If you’d like to work at an innovative fintech with a global footprint that is redefining the industry, then we want you!
The Provenir AI team is a centralized function responsible for all things data, analytics, and ML/AI of Provenir. The team consists of Cloud Architects, Data Engineers, Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Mangers and Program Managers. It is our team's mission to disrupt longstanding players in the value chain by building a distributed AI/ML platform to drive best-in-class decisions.
We’re seeking a Data Scientist to apply state-of-the-art Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence methods to large amounts of data from different sources to build and deploy modeling solutions in any one of the below domains:
fraud prevention, detection and mitigation solutions; OR
credit risk modelling solutions for financials lenders such as other digital fintechs, BNPL providers, car finance providers or banks
other customer management solutions, including credit line optimization and recommendation system
Exposure to at least fraud prevention or credit risk modelling is necessary (both is a bonus). Don’t worry if you only have exposure to one, you will have the chance to be exposed to the other.
In this role, you will co-create and validate AI and ML models that automate and enhance our fraud detection capabilities, credit modeling capabilities and other customer management solutions
Our ideal team member will have the mathematical, statistical and technology expertise you’d expect, but also a creative and curious mindset to help solve clients’ most demanding challenges.
Responsibilities:
Analyze data (past customer behavior, sales inputs, alternative data and other sources) to identify trends and create modeling solutions with clear recommendations
FRAUD: Determine indicators (patterns) of potential fraud and conceptualize ways to automatically detect instances. Identify relevant data sources to improve fraud and anomaly detection and compromised account prevention
CREDIT: Help identify and source relevant data (including alternative data) to build, calibrate and tune state-of-the-art credit risk models using the latest AI/ML technologies and approaches
Partner with Product and Engineering teams to support implementation in our cloud platform
Claim end-to-end ownership of your models and solutions: from ideation to implementation
While working in a fast-paced environment, interpret, document and successfully communicate analytic work and/or results to stakeholders, including those in non-analytic roles, generating recommendations to cross-functional teams and leadership
Be involved in the whole process of model development. This includes everything from root cause analysis, data collection and feature engineering to training, validating and implementing machine learning models, computing performance statistics and live model monitoring

What’s Required:
Education – Bachelor’s degree in a numeric discipline, such as (but not limited to): statistics, mathematics, data science, engineering, econometrics, actuarial science. Post-graduate degree such as Coursework Masters, Research Masters of PhD in related discipline is a bonus.
Experience – at least 3 to 5 years’ experience in data science role exposed to fraud and/or credit modeling
FRAUD: Experience in building predictive models to classify fraud patterns such as account takeover, card not present, money laundering, social engineering etc.
CREDIT: Experience in building predictive models to estimate credit risk such as application scorecards, behavioral scorecards, probability of default, SME rating models, optimization etc.
Development and monitoring of supervised and unsupervised advanced machine learning algorithms (Gradient boosted decision trees, Random forest, K-means clustering etc)
Strong data wrangling skills, merging, cleansing, sampling etc
Programming skills (at least one of): Python (pandas/numpy/sklearn/seaborn), R (tidyverse), SQL
Comfortable working in a dynamic, research-oriented group with several concurrent projects
Experience with H2O.ai, OpenCypher, TensorFlow and AWS is a bonus
Our employees are our top priority, we offer comprehensive health and wellness plans. You will enjoy paid time off and company holidays, flexible and remote-friendly opportunities, and maternity/paternity leave along with retirement benefits to plan for your future.
At Provenir, we recognize that diversity and inclusion make our teams stronger. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and welcome everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, citizenship, or veteran status or medical condition. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

COMPETENCIES

Bold

Nuestra compañía fue fundada en Mayo de 2019 por un equipo de personas increíbles y con una experiencia única, el grupo de fundadores está conformado por los creadores de PayU Latam y otras empresas expertas en tecnología financiera. Estamos creando soluciones de pago y de banca para MiPymes, independientes y emprendedores en Colombia. Actualmente contamos con más de 100.000 clientes registrados en nuestra plataforma y hemos recibido más de USD $60 millones de fondos de inversión nacionales y extranjeros, somos una de las startups de más rápido crecimiento en LatAm en el sector fintech.
Por medio de nuestros productos, nuestros clientes pueden recibir pagos electrónicos de manera presencial a través de un datáfono móvil y también de forma remota a través de enlaces de pago, adicionalmente nos estamos preparando para operar como entidad financiera con nuevos productos orientados a banca digital como cuentas y créditos.
Utilizando un enfoque ágil y las mejores prácticas de desarrollo, construimos una plataforma bajo una arquitectura sin servidor y al mismo tiempo cumplimos con los más altos estándares de seguridad y calidad. Para más información acerca de Bold visite nuestro sitio web: https://bold.co

Deberás

Construir e implementar de manera metódica y disciplinada modelos analíticos siguiendo la metodología, con el fin de optimizar procesos dentro de la organización por medio de bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales.
Apoyar la actualización de modelos que hayan perdido eficacia a través del tiempo.
Desarrollar análisis y tratamiento de datos que permitan apoyar la toma de decisiones a diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Administrar y gestionar modelos contratados a terceros, garantizando que no pierdan su eficacia y funcionalidad.
Realizar pruebas de concepto para la viabilidad e integración de modelos proporcionados por terceros, nuevas herramientas de machine learning y BI.
Diseñar, medir, analizar y monitorear experimentos analíticos que se estén ejecutando en Bold.
Entender los procesos y el recurso humano de la organización, con el fin de diseñar soluciones analíticas adecuadas y que genere impacto claro y medible en el negocio
¿Qué encontrarás en Bold?

Un equipo con alto nivel de excelencia y calidad humana
Un equipo de Analítica y Ciencia de datos orientado al resultado, que crea, investiga y desarrolla soluciones para nuestros clientes
